Reviews.Title: “my stay”
Reviews.Author: yenisel s
Reviews.Content: I stayed in March and I must say I really enjoyed it. The room was very nice and clean and the welcoming was very warm. The attendants name was Nora Cruz and she really helped me out with everything, keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great concierge!!”
Reviews.Author: Miguel_d_ez
Reviews.Content: I unexpectedly went to this hotel without reservation during spring break after missing a flight, and the staff (particularly the awesome Dave Arteaga) was extremely accomodating and went out of their way to fulfill the whims I had from being exhausted from a 14 hour trip. The room was what's you would expect from a big, reasonable priced hotel, very good rest, great AC, top quality blinds for extra sleep after sunrise and a very decent breakfast. My time at the Red Roof, although brief, was rejuvenating! The post-check-out support was amazing as well !! <3

Reviews.Title: “lacking service”
Reviews.Author: Adam K
Reviews.Content: Arrived to the property expecting very little but was pleasantly surprised by the appearance of the room. Mattress seems comfortable as well. As I have been away on business, I needed to do laundry and was directed by the front desk to the laundry room. I had added coins and detergent to a load and after adding $1.50 in quarters, the machine did not start. I looked behind the machine and it and all others were disconnected from power and water supply. There were no signs that said "Out Of Order". I went back to the front desk and complained. The individual went to the laundry room to check for himself and the reported to me exactly what i told him. He did not volunteer to refund my money. When I asked, he told me that I am going to need to take this up with the people that own the machines. There was no apology. It was I that suggested that a sign be placed on the machine so that no one else falls victim to this. I had called when I made the reservation to find out that they had laundry facilities knowing that I was going to need to launder clothes for the second half of my trip so this is a great disappointment. In the hotel business, clean rooms and comfortable beds will only get you so far. Service matters too.

Reviews.Title: “Newest and best”
Reviews.Author: Mathew S
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel because some friends, who had stayed there, recomended to me. At the begining, while booking the room, I hesitated because I though that low rates would come with low quality. But when I got there, it was totally different, the hotel shuttle service was convinient, the hotel looks really good, the front desk service was great, especially from "Sergio", and the room was really good and just renovated. I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for good prices and quality.

Reviews.Title: “great Hotel - Great People”
Reviews.Author: axel h
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just 5 mn from the airpot, great for business travelers. The Hotel people is very friendly ( Marta the Manager is a great person ).

Reviews.Title: “I was really impressed”
Reviews.Author: Jtaylor529
Reviews.Content: Normally when I thought about the red roof I think motel. But once I was there it was a pleasant surprise top know it was not. The staff was helpful and the rooms were impressive. I will recommend

Reviews.Title: “My First Stay in Red Roof Inn!”
Reviews.Author: G M
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay @ Red Roof Inn. The staff and manager were extremely helpful. Great customer service, room was super clean the price was very affordable for excellent quality. Staff made sure my needs were fulfilled. I would rcomend this hotel to my friends and family anytime.

Reviews.Title: “The best stay you can possibly have in Miami”
Reviews.Author: Wesley909
Reviews.Content: The staff was extremely helpful, there was excellent customer service, rooms were clean and neat, affordable prices for great quality. The assistant manager MR. Vargas made sure all of our needs were for filled . Every hotel needs a manager like him.

Reviews.Title: “october trip 2011”
Reviews.Author: ilenia k
Reviews.Content: awesome stay at this hotel,,, staff was wonderfull and also the accomodation. it was nice and clean. and a restaurant at side,.. we would like to thank especially Marta who helped us with our stay. we appreciate it so much and will stay again here.. we really like the decoration of our room for our aniversary Marta did for us.. thanks a lot Marta

Reviews.Title: “If your looking for an easy place to stay for airport travel- STAY AWAY!”
Reviews.Author: blondy5584
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Red Roof Inn last night for an overnight layover on our flight home from our honeymoon. We chose Red Roof because of the low price and free shuttle to the airport since we only needed a place to stay for 10 hours. The hotel states that they have a shuttle that runs every 30 minutes to and from the airport from 5am-1am. We waited almost 45minutes to get picked up and then in the morning when we arrived in the lobby at 5am to get on the shuttle for our 6:45am flight the driver decided to not show up for work. The hotel staff called and he said he would arrive by 5:40a and then showed up at 6am causing us and another passenger to miss our flights. The $110 that we payed for the night was not worth the extra loses from missing our flight. Also the hotel was not anything special. We were placed in the 2nd building with a broken elevator where we had to cross a boarded up hall under construction that was full of trash to get to the other working elevator. Our room was fine for a quick nights stay as long as you dont mind holes in the bedding and dont want to shower. The shower was covered in soap scum and limescale. The area outside is nowhere that you want to walk at night with loud drunks falling down. Overall we normally dont mind staying in a less than optimal hotel for a quick overnight flight but in this case it was definitely not worth it. We would have been better off paying an extra $50 for a reliable hotel to end off our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable and close to airport.”
Reviews.Author: Radar7330
Reviews.Content: Price was a little more than I would have liked for the room but it was really convenient access to the airport. Shuttle service was prompt and free. Room was newly refurbished. Some detail work was a little shabby but by and large it was clean and comfortable. They were still doing some remodeling on the lower floors so as of 1/15/12 there was some morning construction noise at about 8am that wasn't disclosed at booking. The experience as a whole was positive and it was a convenient place to stay right next to MIA. Keep in mind since it is so close to the airport aircraft noise can be heard. That is not unexpected though from an airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for stay, park and cruise / fly”
Reviews.Author: Kosar2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers a great deal for stay, park and cruise (or Fly). With one night stay at around $100, we were able to leave our car in their secure and gated parking lot for 2 weeks free PLUS got free shuttle ride to Miami Cruiseport for all four of us (other hotels would only cover 2 adults). Also, other park and cruise places around Miami cruise port charged as much, but they all seem to have security issues. Location is about 10 minutes from cruiseport, and only cost us $25 for a taxi to get back. The hotel is very nice and clean. Rooms are all recently renovated featuring hardwood floors and upgraded appliances. The beds were very comfortable and, most important to us, the sheets were clean and fresh. Hotel staff is very courteous and they served a complementary breakfast. Check in and out was quick and hassle free. Overall, we were very satisfied with our choice!!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for someone having a stop over between flights”
Reviews.Author: mick s
Reviews.Content: I had a stop over in Miami and a flight the next day, when I arrived I was treated fast and efficently by the staff the room was clean and in good condition, the TV was big as was the bed I would recommend this hotel to anybody. You really can not pass it up for the price. The next day the free shuttle took me to the airport, no hassles.

Reviews.Title: “Albert -- Aruba”
Reviews.Author: Albert1115
Reviews.Content: Hi, we stayed with our family and group at the Miami airport Red Roof inn last October and it was wonderfull. We stayed before and after cruising and nothing to complain. Deals and staff was great. Especially Marta . It was really a pleasure dealing with Marta for our stay. continental breakfast was a good start for the day. The hotel's location and rooms are excellent. There is a Bennigan's aside the hotel to eat great. Once again thanks Marta. Albert

Reviews.Title: “Oh My Goodness!!!”
Reviews.Author: KDHawaii
Reviews.Content: This is the best room I ever stayed in. The floor was great. The mattress was awesome. I slept good. IT is a wonderful hotel. Pet stays free. yay! The only bad thing about this hotel is they do not provide cereal for breakfast. I highly recommend this place. You'll love it. Be sure to get superior king room. They have flat screen TV which is awesome

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in this location”
Reviews.Author: 9kids
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Red Roof Inns before and found them to be comfortable. This location, however, was disappointing to us. Although the website info, the outdoor sign, and a flashing banner behind the desk advertised "free wi-fi", it was not working during the duration of our stay, and we were not offered any sort of compensation, monetary or otherwise. It was very disappointing to us that we were not able to email our family before leaving on our cruise. When I reported the issue to the manager, I expected that, at the very least, I would be offered a free in-room movie to entertain my very disppointed son, but this was not to be. Nor was I offered an incentive to make a future stay. It was obvious to me that this hotel does not expect nor desire repeat business. The tv remote in our room did not work, nor did 2 of the 3 electrical outlets in the room. The office chair in the room was badly stained, there was a large chunk of baseboard/wallboard missing in the corner, the toilet did not flush properly, and the only restaurant within walking distance was primarily a tavern. I would have given a lower score, but the hotel staff was very pleasant and and the shuttle to the cruise port was comfortable and ran on time. We received the room type we had requested, and it was close to the lobby area, which was a bonus since there was no in-room coffeemaker.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there”
Reviews.Author: Jim S
Reviews.Content: We flew in at 10:30pm. Were told, by hotel phone operator, to catch the shuttle on 2nd level of the parking garage. We found a lot of cars there but, of course, no shuttle bus. By the time we learned that the shuttles and taxi's passed by on the 2nd level of the concourse (not the parking garage) the last shuttle of the day had come and gone. It was the last shuttle of the day so we were not even given the correct information from the gal who worked the phone at the hotel, i.e., wrong place to catch the shuttle and wrong info re when the last one would pick up hotel customers. We got a taxi and the hotel did reimbursed us for the basic taxi fare (not the tip). Next day, returning to the airport, we had to take a taxi again because the, apparently only shuttle bus, had broken down. The people who work at the hotel don't seem to know what's going on. For folks who are in Miami for the first time they are worse than useless.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Marilyn M
Reviews.Content: I was on a quick business trip to the Miami area and stayed at the Red Roof Inn. Apparently, they just went through a major renovation and the hotel is not short of fabulous. I usually stay in five star hotels but got to tell you-- this is a great property, excellent room, service was outstanding and most importantly they have FREE wifi and the rate woo hoo my boss is going to think I am a hero--Boy did I get a great deal . If youâ€™re going to Miami check it out. Great Property

Reviews.Title: “Seek elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Birotteau
Reviews.Content: What you would expect in a (very) basic, spartan hotel, only that it badly needs renovation. The rooms are purportedly renovated, which does not show. Breakfast is modest, service is non-existent. Beware of HIDDEN CHARGES: internet is only for free on your own computer, if you use the hotel's computer you get charged by the hour, and packages are stored for a modest fee of US$1 per package per day. That small purchase that arrived early will be more expensive in storage fees than in cost of purchase! If you are using it because of a late / early flight in Miami it is barely OK. No other use would justify coming here.

Reviews.Title: “Looking for a nice Hotel and nice Service, stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: peter m
Reviews.Content: I made my reservation online, getting a no expensive rate (just for a few hours) expecting a simple or bad hotel/service. But, it resulted to be the opposite. I found a great and renovated room, a great service, specially from the young and friendly gentleman Sergio, complementary breakfast early in the morning, and a free shuttle service running just as good as needed.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel being drastically improved - be patient”
Reviews.Author: prodigiouswizard
Reviews.Content: Pros: * Free Wifi & parking & simple breakfast * Close to airport w/shuttle (didn't take it but saw it running fairly consistently) * Clean room and very quiet (we read the reviews & asked for a room near the poolside, which is quiet), I can imagine that the airport side is more noisy * Staff is very helpful and friendly * Only a dozen minutes to Jungle Island, Viscaya, more attractions * Winnable on Priceline as a 2*, key bc Miami hotels are expensive! Notes: * The hotel is being renovated and the poolside rooms are done, they are nice and clean -the airport side will be done within 4 months as I asked the front desk, so after that, this hotel will be quite nice * Management seems to respond to the comments here, and as long as they dont just pay lip service, the complaints should will be addressed (we didnt see any in-room cleanliness issues or shuttle delays) Cons: * The plumbing needs some work, our bathtub backed up very easy and we were standing in a bunch of water at the end of our shower * Our A/C unit couldnt pump out heat...the heat and cold setting both pumped out cold air * Hallway is quite dirty & dusty due to the renovations

Reviews.Title: “Temptingly close to the airport == don't bother!”
Reviews.Author: Arkansastraveler69
Reviews.Content: We eeded a fast and easy place to stay. Our international flight got it at mid-night and we had to be back to the airport by 6 AM. Being only 3 minutes from the terminal, and cheap, this looked ideal, BUT, we wanted a shuttle to pick us up. Having read several negative reviews about their shutle "service", we called the motel and s/w the manager. At least, he ID'd himself as such. We explained the date and time, and that by the time we cleared Customs, it would likely be 1:00 AM. No problem he said. I'll put a note in the computer, so, just call, and we will be there. So, we made the reservation. On the day of our arrival, we walked to the shuttle curb at 1:05 AM and called the Inn. Sorry the clerk said, shuttle quit running at 12:30. We explained the promise. Too bad. Call the manage I requested. No, you can talk to him in the morning. So, it cost us $11 for the three minute taxi ride. The lobby was being remodled, and was a construction site to manuever. The room was as far from the check in desk as possible, and had not been used for days --- at least 10 Pizza ads pushed under the door. The room clock was impossible to set -- either time or the alarm. We were relieved to get out of there at 5:30. The so called free breakfaast was small sweet rolls, juice, and coffee. Needless to say, do not stay here if you need a late night shuttle or expect friendly helpful service. They will promise anything, and deliver as little as possible

Reviews.Title: “overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: jocke123
Reviews.Content: ok for transitflights...! far from civilasation....shuttle service...!

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE - DIRTY - BED BUGS AND BEWARE OF TRANSFERS.”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugs77
Reviews.Content: When initially doing research for booking we were going to stay at Hampton Inn Ft. Lauderdale, we had received prompt and courteous communications back from their General Manager David Blevins who was so helpful and very friendly however he advised us prior to booking his hotel did not offer transfers to port of Miami and only went to everglades so unfortunately we decided not to stay. Big Mistake. Red Roof Inn â€“ One wordâ€¦.Disgusting !!!! I am defiantely a glass is half full kind of a person but not when it comes to this hotel. I can say Red Roof Inn is by far the worst hotel we have ever stayed at. We only booked this purely because we were travelling on Allure of The Seas the following day and when looking online we noticed that the hotel offered complimentary airport transfers as well as transfers the following day to the cruise port. As our cruise was departing from Port Of Miami not Port Everglades My husband called from Australia just to make sure they would take us there which we were told yes. My husband made a few attempts to book via email however communication was very slow and poor so he decided to book online using a booking site. This should of been alarm bells to us but we decided to go ahead purely because of the transfers. So the night before we arrived into Miami we actually phone front desk from San Francisco and asked them if we needed to let them know our flight times in order to pick us up for the transfers. The person on the front desk advised no and that a shuttle went to and from the airport every 30 minutes. Ok no problem sounded like it was all going to be ok.... Well it wasnâ€™t. Our 6 hour flight was long and tiring, we collected our baggage from the carrousel approx 9:20 pm, it took is about 10 minutes to get up to the next level and were at the pick-up zone by 9:30 - We figured we possibly may have just missed the bus on its loop and thought it must have been there at either 9.15 or just before 9.30 so thought the next one would be around sometime soon perhaps - 9.45 or 10.00. All other shuttles were going round and round - some passing us over 2 or 3 times and soon we were the last people standing waiting. At 10.15 we decided enough was enough and decided to call the hotel. The person on the phone told us the bus had only just left 10 minutes ago and should be there soon. It wasnâ€™t until about 10.40 that our shuttle finally rocked up - over an hour waiting at the pick-up zone. When the driver dropped us at the hotel we proceeded to check in and noticed that the driver parked the bus and walked over the television and was watching the baseball game that was on - It all started to make sense and we realised that as the drive only took 5 minutes to get there we were obviously lied to by getting told that the bus had left 10 minutes ago and should be there any minute. The whole time he was probably standing watching the baseball and if we hadnâ€™t of called we would of still been waiting. As it was after we called it still took 25 minutes to come and get us and for a 5 minute journey with absolutely no traffic it was evident that there was no haste to come and collect us. I really hope no other suckers were waiting to be picked up after us because about half and hour after we checked in we went back through the foyer to try and find somewhere to get something to eat and book our transfers to port of miami for the following day and the driver was in the same position watching the baseball still....TERRIBLE! For the port transfers we advised our cruise, the port and the time we had to be there and the guy just told us to write our name on the list and to be ready for collection at 12. Secondly the room - it smelly DISGUSTING and when we opened the door there were about 30 or so pamphlets that were thrown under the door to various takeaway to gambling - there were also loads of scattered sheets of paper all down the hall way - obviously they just let anyone in off the street up near the rooms to put whatever paraphernalia under their door. Walking from the check in building out to our building where our room was we passed a bunch of thugs sitting around the complex looking like they were up to no good. Unsure if they were guests or just using the place as a hang out they made us feel very uncomfortable and somewhat unsafe. Thirdly woke up the next morning with bites sporadic bites over me. I slept under the covers and later realised I had been bitten by bed bugs. This made me feel so sick and dirty - I was just beside myself. Lastly but not least... We proceed down to the foyer, check out in plenty of time for our 12.00 transfers to Port Of Miami to find out that they have too many people and we had to wait until 1pm. Although we were miffed we still politely and patiently waited and then at 1pm the next shuttle came, we loaded our luggage on the bus and the driver asked which terminal - we told him and he apologised but said he didnâ€™t go to Port Of Miami and only went to the Port Everglades and thought we would have been told this. He felt really bad knowing he turned us away over an hour ago for the first shuttle as he couldnâ€™t fit us on the first bus then having to tell us this bad news. He said we would have to get a taxi which would cost $80 and took us into the front desk where my husband spoke to the desk who were unable to help us with anything apart from calling us a taxi. We had to be at our port by 2.00pm and were told its about a 40 minute drive so had no time to argue but told them how incredibly angry we were and left. So all in all this was the WORST inn / hotel whatever you want to call it we have EVER stayed in. All we really cared that it was clean, comfortable and included our transfers as stated and advised. Each and every aspect failed. Clean - FAILED !! - Bed bugs and bad smells ! Airport Transfers - FAILED !! We had to wait 1 hour and 10 minutes for a transfer that apparently is available without bookings required at least every 30 minutes. After a long commute this was horrendous. Port Transfers - FAILED !!! The ONLY reason we even booked here and ended up having to ensure all of this was because we were advised they would drop us at OUR port, we specifically mentioned OUR port at least 3 times so evidentially they do not know the concept of listening. The whole nights stay here was completely futile and ended up costing us more money by having to by itch cream as a result of the bed bugs, having to pay for a nightâ€™s accommodation in a dirty hovel and then having to pay $80 for a taxi when we were told they would take us to Port of Miami but then didnt. Due to their lack of listening and communication by not telling us they didnâ€™t go to our port also resulted in us running late for our cruise check in. FAIL FAIL FAIL - Do not stay here, spend the extra money and go somewhere better. I regret not going with Hampton Inn Ft. Lauderdale â€“ although they didnâ€™t offer transfers at least we knew that up front and at least we would have stayed in a clean and comfortable place with good reviews, service and hospitality. Stay away from Red Roof Inn.

Reviews.Title: “I had an Excellent Trip”
Reviews.Author: Wilfred_Rahming
Reviews.Content: I had a great trip with the help of Inira and Marta's help.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for 1 night”
Reviews.Author: swimswithturtle
Reviews.Content: Clean, average room. Breakfast was only toast, don't expect much from that. And DO expect planes flying overhead from the airport at all hours. VERY hard to get too. It sits off of a few main roads and freeways. It took us about 40 minutes to get to it once we could see it.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Beverley J
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here three times before now, mostly overnight but this time it was for three nights. I love it because of the close proximity to the airport and the fact that they provide a shuttle bus service to and from the airport. The staff is friendly and very helpfull starting from the shuttle bus driver right up to the General Manager. The bus driver was extremely helpful with directions to places that I could only give a vague description on. I was allowed to check in 6 hours before check-in and that gave me time to settle in after my early morning flight from Jamaica to Miami. They even have a scale to allow you to check your luggage weights so that you know where you stand before you leave for the airport. I also loved the specials given on room rates at certain times of the year. BJamaica

Reviews.Title: “IT WAS FOR ONE NIGHT.”
Reviews.Author: Dennis M
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night ,courteous staff,close proximity to the airport and business district. The Free airport shuttle is a plus.. I would not hesitate to recomend The Red Roof Inn Miami.

Reviews.Title: “short stay but nice”
Reviews.Author: Tom60742
Reviews.Content: I had to stay in this hotel for one night because of familiar problems, but it didn't matter my bad mood or the time, 1:00 am, once I got in the front desk, I found a polite and friendly guy called Sergio who understood my situation and inmediately checked me in with a good price and in a beautiful room.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, staff, free shuttle”
Reviews.Author: TNmomKnoxville_TN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Red roof inn for $89 for one night. We stayed there because we were leaving the next day for a cruise and wanted to use the free shuttle to the port. The cab ride back to pick up our car wasnt that bad. Free to leave your car there if you stayed as a guest, otherwise $3 a day parking to leave your car there if you were not a guest. We have taken too many cruises to pay $20 a day. it only took one cruise at $140 parking cost for us to learn to shop around.. the expensive hotels still charge you to park and offer no shuttle. the cheap hotels let you park for free and will shuttle you there free as well. we were only staying to save money on parking for our cruise, but the hotel was actually pretty nice. The staff was friendly and the pool and landscape was night. I liked that the cars and entrance to your room was behind a locked gate and you have to be a guest to get in. Made me free pretty safe. The free breakfast wasnt that great but I didnt really mind danishes and juice. There is not much selection other than that. We take another cruise I am sure we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good price and great service”
Reviews.Author: camille1977
Reviews.Content: We stayed there twice already and it was a nice place great location and polite staff.

Reviews.Title: “Better price, Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: frank m
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel after missing my flight to New York due to the Hurricane. The first thing that I though was that I wouldn't be able to book in any hotel as soon as there were many people in my situation, but what I found was that all the hotels in that area had extremely increased the prices. But as soon as I got in the Red Roof at the airport whith my children I found a very kind boy called Sergio , who was attending many people at the same time, but was able to give me a razonable rate according to the circunstances. But it is not the end of my story, when I went to the room it was clean, beautiful, quiet, and the next day, early in the morning, I was able to take complementary breakfast and a shuttle that got me to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Elaine S
Reviews.Content: I was so impressed with the good old fashion customer service. We turned up a day early, and they tried there very best to accomadate us and found us fantastic hotel near the beach, gave us simply clear directions and also the manager used his contact to make sure we didn't pay over the odds... We then came to stay in the Red Roof for the next night and the rooms were clean basic breakfast but just what you needed if using it for an airport stop.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: VivianeEduardo
Reviews.Content: Large rooms, free wi fi, free parking, free shuttle to the airport, good breakfast, pool open late. Helpful staff. And despite the proximity to the airport, the room is not noisy. The only problem was the carpet in the room that was always damp, but nothing to discredit the hotel. And the price is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Woke up with bed bug bites.”
Reviews.Author: leogirl212
Reviews.Content: We were directed to this hotel from American Airlines we missed our connecting flight home. The room was horrible, stained carpets and noisy hall and we had two small children. This is the least of my concerns, you may ask why...well bed bug bites have left my ankles and feet very uncomfortable and still I am still having issues. Will be heading to our clinic later for an anti itch precription before infection sets in. And yes they were bed bug bites because we saw two of the bugs crawling in the bed right by my two year olds head. GROSS! I will never be returning here or any Red Roof Inn. So if you are planning to stay at this location please reconsider and spend a few extra bucks for better nights sleep at another area hotel.

Reviews.Title: “clean and decent”
Reviews.Author: JonathanSe
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews here before booking and was a little hisitant but I was pleasantly surprised about how clean the hotel was and helpful the staff was. This hotel real close to the airport and planes fly in directly over the hotel like every 5 to minutes going in for landing. The noise is evident when you are outside but you barely here a thing in your room and they stop sometime during the evening. I like that the pool has a tropical setting where you can just lay by the side and be shaded by wonderful healthy trees. The breakfast area is eat in or just outside on the terrace. You can watch guess check in or watch people relaxing over by the pool even though the area is partly blocked by schrubs. I saw no bugs and no roaches. Just a fresh water bubble over the shower. Notthing to chase you away. You can walk over to Benegans restaurant. This property appears to be very safe for parking as you have to enter through and park behimd the gates. and you have to use your room key to access the second building after hours. I recommend this hotel for a quiet get away, notting overly fancy but very decent.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: beccy1606
Reviews.Content: Stayed twice during our time in Florida, the first time for 2 nights, the second time for 5 nights. Although this hotel is geared more towards people just staying overnight travelling to and from the airport, we used it for our entire stay in Miami as we were forced to book last minute and it was the only one in our price range that wasn't described as terrible in reviews! Still, we were worried about staying for so long, but we were pleasantly surprised! The service was friendly and efficient and we were impressed with the comfort and cleanliness of the rooms. It's no luxury, but it's adequate, especially for the price. There is a small shop selling, snacks, drinks and toiletries among other bits and bobs, and a cash machine. We also used the pool which is decent considering the hotel is not really meant for long stay. As I said, the hotel is mainly aimed as a short stop-over for travellers (which it is perfect for). Having said that, it served as a perfectly adequate base for our whole stay in Miami, during which we were mostly out and about anyway. The only thing I would criticise is the breakfast. It is a very basic continental breakfast limited to bagels and toast (with jam, cream cheese or butter), apples and tea, coffee, apple and orange juice (that is literally it!). Again, it's fine if you are only eating it for one day, not so good for us eating it for 5 days straight! But then we just got breakfast out instead some days. Anyway to summarize, we enjoyed staying here, it is a decent, well priced hotel. It's clean, comfortable, friendly, and perfect for the airport, but it can still be used as a general base for a stay in Miami, as long as you have transport and will be mostly out and about!

Reviews.Title: “close to the airport. very cheap for Miami”
Reviews.Author: lassie79
Reviews.Content: Just for one night this was good it served the purpose of a nights sleep before an early flight out of Miamai International. The rooms were reasonalbe although very drab and the air cond was freezing and we turned it to the lowest setting but even that was like ice. There was a pool. Breakfast was included for what it was worth, we waited till we got to the airport....., but on the plus side they provided free shuttle to the airport and we had a good nights sleep so it served the purpose, but look somewhere else if this is for holiday location..as" This is not it."

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and clean rooms!!!”
Reviews.Author: TheWiZEGUY
Reviews.Content: Free parking, free breakfast , free internet, free long distance calls was provided. Hurray!!!. Very nice staff, also they allowed me to use the lobby computer free of charge to print mapquest directions and much more. I am happy.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: mssunshine82
Reviews.Content: I do not recommend anyone stay here, if they're expecting a comfortable stay. The website and previous reviews are false advertisement. We booked this hotel for 4 nights, and checked out the very next day. We arrived to a room that smelled horrible. The desk next to the tv had crumbs or dirt on it. We saw bugs in the bathroom, and people were living in the hotel as well. It literally made me sick to my stomach to where I could not sleep. You get what you pay for, PLEASE DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY LIKE I DID!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Inn”
Reviews.Author: mrylove29
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Miami Red Roof last week and we are really impressed about how comfortable the rooms are and the excellent serviced received. Mr Rodriguez Gustavo was very helpful and helped us with suggestions of tourist attractions near your installation.

Reviews.Title: “"Great hotel, great service"”
Reviews.Author: 9saltlife
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Red Roof in Miami last week and it was a very nice experience. The rooms are nice and properly cleaned every day. The complementary services like breakfast and transportation to he airport are very convenient. The staff is great, and in particular Sergio was very helpful giving us directions to different areas to go shopping. He also was very attentive to our needs. We really appreciate the service we received.

Reviews.Title: “checked & and back out”
Reviews.Author: ttdell
Reviews.Content: before i checked in, we saw a 'gathering' of large men with their large dogs at the lobby door- almost blocking entry. but when i got to the front desk, i saw what appeared to be 'negotiations' between a barely dressed(in heels woman and a john by the pation doors. still- i got the key. my husband in the meantiime, had been solicited while waiting for me in the car. As we made it through the gate and around back, our sense of security continued to fade: duct-taped windows, screeching cars, etc. so- within 5 minutes, i went back in and 'checked out'. the front desk mgr. was understanding and assured me (with receipt) -no charges on my card.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, exellent front desk service.”
Reviews.Author: Rebeca63
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as a distressed passenger. For my surprise I received a very convenient rate, and complementary transportation to and from the airport. My stay was very pleasant and convenient. The rooms are very nice and clean. Front desk staff was very attentive, Gustavo one of the employees was very efficient during check in and check out, and in the morning was kind enough to help me with my luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: nunun
Reviews.Content: After long flights and delays i arrived around midnight and check in was really fast. The room is big, clean and the beds and pillows are very comfortable but the hallway smell bad. Nice pool area

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sojourner_am
Reviews.Content: Location is near Coral Gables, not too far from Miracle Mile strip. For the price, it's a great place to stay at. Staff is very nice, they have continental breakfast, and convenient. Must have a car to get around Miami.

Reviews.Title: “good value for the $$”
Reviews.Author: puppykicker5
Reviews.Content: Ignore all the complaints you see in the reviews, this place is clean, great location, and good value for the money. Staff are friendly and helpful, but hey, it is Miami - people definitely take a more relaxed attitude than in other parts of the country. So check in wasn't the quickest, it didn't kill me, and staff was actually really friendly and helpful. Room was fine - clean and well-cared for if not exactly brand-new, working tv, wireless internet and ac. Airport shuttle runs every half-hour, more or less on time. Location isn't the greatest if you're looking to explore the city, but if you just need a place to crash between flights it works well.

Reviews.Title: “Great place overall.”
Reviews.Author: Bluetiger500
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience and stay at this hotel. Eduardo, one of the employees there, was really nice to me. And help me out with my luggage.

Reviews.Title: “The customer service was first class and very friendly attendants.”
Reviews.Author: Dale23_12
Reviews.Content: During my stay I was treated with respect and care. I was just staying for a mini-vacation to enjoy the beach and the sights. Once I arrived I was greeted with a smile by an Eddy Barreto who assisted me very quickly at the front desk. My room was ready and waiting. My stay went very well and accomodating. My room was clean and organized . All in all the service and room was very high class with an economical value. I would highly recommend it to a friend or family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!!!”
Reviews.Author: davidrgonz
Reviews.Content: I went to Miami for an emergency trip and was not in a good mood at all because of it. However, starting from the service at the front desk with Mr. Barreto or Eddie as he told me to call him, my mood quickly changed. Everything was better than expected and I was welcomed very warmly by the personnel.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!”
Reviews.Author: highpockets352
Reviews.Content: Very, very dirty! Dark and smelly hallways. Very shocked to see such a place that claims to have recent renovations. Never will trust a Red Roof Inn again after this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you have to”
Reviews.Author: superA777
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel when my american airlines flight required that I had to stay overnight. I received a "special' rate as a distressed traveler. There is no way that I would have stayed at this hotel if I had had any other choice! The only thing preventing this hotel from getting 1 star is the fact that you get free internet. I spent the first 20 minutes of my stay looking for another hotel to stay in. The staff is NOT friendly or helpful at all. They acted bored and could not answer any question I asked. The location is close to the airport and there is a Bennigans Restaurant next door. The rooms were not terrible, but not the most clean. There was liberal use that generic orange spray that is suppose to make you think something is clean. Thank goodness no bedbugs! Breakfast is coffee, an apple, and a danish in a plastic wrapper. Not very much of a breakfast. The hotel shuttle is reliable in taking you to the airport, but we waited over 40 minutes for it to pick us up. I have no plans on staying there ever again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for our purpose”
Reviews.Author: pjsmom5106
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Red Roof inn this past Sunday (3/20) for an overnight stay before our cruise,we stayed on the 2nd floor in the 2nd building the room was clean and actually better than I expected I've never stayed at any "Inns" or "Motels" so I was really concerned about the quality but everything was just fine, the price for me was even better with me using my airline employee rate not all hotels take those rates, but without it the price wasn't bad being an airport hotel usally they are much more, there was a light breakfast served from 6a-10a (danish,coffe,tea toast,bagels etc.) just something to get you started.....The only complaint I have is that the comp. shuttle from the airport to the hotel was a LONG wait.....I had to call the hotel 3x's to ask where the shuttle was they say it leaves every 30mins but we waited on the curb for an hour so I don't know what that was about and once it did come to pick us up it was full we had to stand up, but come to find out there is only one shuttle, so if they had more (shuttles) the process would probably be a lot smoother and faster, that same shuttle does the comp service to the cruise terminal it does a lot of running around so it maybe good for them to invest in another shuttle bus. Oh and the other thing is the cruise shuttle leaves once at 1p so if you wanted to get to the terminal earlier then you would need to take a cab, but on the day of my departure, the 1pm shuttle filled up (you have to sign up)so they called me that morning and advise me that they are going to have another shuttle time of 12pm which was great being as though I wanted to get to the ship earlier, the check out process was fast and the staff was friendly the other down side is that on arrival with that full shuttle there was only 2 reps. there to check in about 12 people so that took a while......

Reviews.Title: “wonderful staff and service”
Reviews.Author: ksang17
Reviews.Content: The staff at the desk were very welcoming. The breakfast lady was freindly and worked hard. The breakfast choices were mediocre, but loved the coffee and the fact that we could have whole wheat bread. I was even able to get fruit. Rooms I saw were clean and nicely maintained. The shuttle service and proximity to airport was very convenient for us. Overall a good experience that I would repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for cruise passangers”
Reviews.Author: bob_bra
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the day before our cruise using the cruise port package. The package included 14 days free parking , and free transportation to the ship. We returned 12 days later to find our car with no damage. This is an older hotel that is well maintained but shows some signs of wear and has a dated look. Our room was large, clean and quite (but had a load air conditioner). We had a confortable King Sized Bed and a reclining chair. Aircraft fly over the hotel but the soundproofing was excellent. We had no surprises in check in and check out with no deviation from our reservation. The staff was friendly, helpfull and provided needed directions to find stores near the hotel. This is a budget priced hotel that was fuuly booked whe we were there. The free breakfast was standard fare with lots of breads, fruit and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Red Roof Inn in the US???”
Reviews.Author: ianjmorley
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Red Roof inns near many US airports and have actually got to the stage where I look out for these inns when I am looking for a night stay near an airport. I made a huge mistake booking into the red roof inn at Miami airport. We turned up on spec to be told they only had rooms with a king size bed available. They then quoted us the same amount as what I'd pay at a Hilton. When I challenged them they told me they wouldn't budge on the rate so i started to walk out the door. They then suddenly found a (significantly) cheaper room with queen beds......the room was the furthest possible away from reception and when we walked in it was like walking into a walk in freezer. The a/c machine was on full blast. We turned it off but as we couldnt open the window nor put any heating on so I spent the evening sat in a coat. Totally crazy. One of the attractions of the inn is that it offered free wi-fi. When I tried to access on my blackberry it I got to the log in page but then it just kept looping back when I clicked the log in button. I reported this to reception who told me the wi-fi didn't work on blackberries. This is despite all their marketing materials in the inn stating that any wi-fi enabled equipment could use the free wi-fi. To top it off we then had someone come into the next room at 1am and make lots of noise for 2 hours - the soundproofing was awful. I found the staff to be rude, unhelpful, and more interested in talking to themselves rather than dealing with their customers. I asked for directions to the car rental place - this was an airport hotel after all. The staff said they didnt know - just told me to head in the direction of the airport. This experience was a real let down for me and totally unexpected given my previous experiences with red roof inns........

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: terry48162
Reviews.Content: We took a cruise out of Miami port on NCL, we came a day early to make sure we made it to the port from Detroit on time. We got to airport early so instead of waiting on red roof shuttle took a cab for $ 15.00. Stacy at the desk got our room ready early for us for check in. The whole staff was great"" , Nice Pool beautiful gardens around patio area, only problem is , this is very close to the airport and planes come in right over the Hotel. very low planes, and loud outside, but in the room only heard a few at night. The breakfeast is small, bagels , toast and some packaged sweet rolls, and coffee and apple juice. the desk personal Manager Indedita and Stacy were great, we got carry out of a local pizza joint, and they did not deliver plates or forks and knives with it. , so Stacy ran next door th the Bennigetons rest. and got some for us. overall for a nights sleep, in a clean room this is a GREAT PLACE to stay, staff very helpful and friendly Terry Monroe Mi 03 08 2011

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced & dumpy with incompetent staff”
Reviews.Author: toddinparis
Reviews.Content: American Airlines booked me on a "distressed passenger" discount on an unexpected stay at this place. At 12 midnight, I found myself in a huge check-in line (due to disorganized front desk help), took 45 minutes from arrival to getting my room key. They put me in a smoky room with holes in the walls, papers flung all over the entrance floor, lamps that didn't work, dirty windows and hair on the bed. I went back to Reception to ask them for some Lysol so I could at least freshen the room, and the clerk abruptly told me that "since you got the airline discount rate, we can't upgrade you to the non-smoking room." I explained I only asked for Lysol, so the manager came over and finally gave me the "upgrade" to non-smoking (this is why I "upgraded" them from a 1 to a 2 rating). Rates here are obscenely high for what you get - they really exploit the distressed airport passengers. Ugly neighborhood. "Breakfast" is nasty, plastic-packaged sugary pastries & coffee is small styrofoam cups. Stains all over the hallway carpet. Well, at least I didn't get bedbugs.

Reviews.Title: “just what i needed”
Reviews.Author: bluefire1359
Reviews.Content: Well i had a great time at this hotel. Although I was only there for one night i liked it just fine. I missed my flight and the airlines sent me here. They gave me a voucher so i didn't have to pay that much. Anyway, the guys at the hotel were great. Eddie, i think his name was, helped me with dinner. I was starving after waiting 6 hours at the airport. He recommended this restaurant to order food from. Very cheap and tasty, just perfect. Later on I had a little run-in with the bathroom and i had to switch rooms. The other guy at the desk, Kenny got me another room in a heartbeat. I don't travel a whole lot but i know when i'm treated right and this place did a fine job.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all what I expected”
Reviews.Author: AlaskanBorn
Reviews.Content: First I want to say that the staff is exceptional, but whom ever owns this hotel takes no pride in it. It is poorly maintained, the minimal has been done to make it "fresh looking". Stairwells spelled like urine, could see were people had relieved themselves. The pool area had garbage over flowing and towels on the floor. The whole hotel just "felt" dirty as well. The "breakfast" was very poor, the orange juice I poured tasted like water, only bagels and packaged sweet rolls, Coffee acceptable. My daughters room had a "flood" stain coming out of the bathroom and the rooms did not smell very pleasant. There were 18 of us registered here. All rooms were below good. I paid 99.00 plus tax.......this hotel is more like a 29.00 room rate. This is not a 2.5 star hotel by any means. The good is that you can leave your vehicle parked while gone on the cruise. They shuttle you to the port...but cannot pick you up after the cruise is ended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for a basic, clean, no-nonsense stay!”
Reviews.Author: SalvadorSegovia
Reviews.Content: Made reservation on same day (Feb 15) and the agent was very accommodating when I requested an early check-in. I waited around 45 minutes for the shuttle but that was ok as I was not in a rush. The shuttle driver was helpful and polite. I checked-in with Nora around 10:45 am and she was very pleasant and efficient. Room #302 was clean with a view of the runway but was relatively quiet thanks to the a/c. The room had a refrigerator, micro-wave, iron & ironing board, hair dryer, tv, and a nice clean bathroom with what looked like wood laminate flooring. There was a clock with alarm but it was too complicated to use and the time was off -- I used my cell phone instead... and the wake-up call requested came as promised. There was free wi-fi which I used and appreciated and free local & US long distance phone calls which I did not avail of. I also used the hotel's parking. There was complimentary continental breakfast which consisted of coffee/tea, apple/orange juice, water, bagels & cream cheese, danish, & apples. After I got into the room, Nora called to check if the room was ok. Then, housekeeping knocked to find out if I needed anything. That was impressive! I was not expecting much so I was pleasantly surprised. The only thing that needed improvement was the bed and the pillows -- It was a large bed (probably king-size) -- and I found it too soft for my liking -- same for the pillows. But I really can't complain as in the end you have to remember and judge everything in relation to what you paid. So I found the value of the Red Roof Inn in Miami to be Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: LAMADRID
Reviews.Content: Booked a group thru hotelplanner.com for a wedding group prior to a cruise. This hotel was awful. Dirty, lack of communication, bad service, no air conditioning in lobby/breakfast room, BED BUGS. Very disappointed and embarrassed that I chose this hotel for a group!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and clean”
Reviews.Author: alimonidani
Reviews.Content: Excellent. Hotel is very clean. Very friendly staff, especially the Assistant GM, Mr. Vargas was very helpful. I strongly recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and service for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: kittygal02
Reviews.Content: Working with the airlines, I travel and stay in hotels all around the world. I have to say that the personnel and service that I received at the Red Roof Inn far exceeded my expectations. The front desk employees were pleasant and accommodating. The room was clean, offered free wi-fi, and a free continental breakfast. It is a superb value and so close to the airport. The shuttle service was prompt. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I didn't have to spend the night in the airport...”
Reviews.Author: Luvsdaweather
Reviews.Content: After our flight was canceled we stayed one night at the red roof inn. The room was very quiet, the staff was courteous and an 11:30 pm call for extra blankets was delivered promptly. Also, we loved the continental breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: ish40
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here! The hotel was very dirty and smelled very bad.

Reviews.Title: “SCABIES, OUCHH!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravellerDoctor
Reviews.Content: After sleeping one night in Room 233 in this hotel, I received numerous insect bites before next day cruise... They turned out to be scabies mites that really became problematic in the ensuing week. Apparently, the sheets in the double bed next to the bath had been slept in by a scaborus person 10 hours before me and had not been laundered. I contacted the hotel later and got a "form" reply. There was no indication that they planned to train their housekeeping staff to change all linens in these rooms with fresh laundered ones. This hotel is used so much by folks as a jumping off point for air and cruise travel. Watch out for this one!!!

Reviews.Title: “I'd pass on this one”
Reviews.Author: pamey
Reviews.Content: Got stuck in Miami overnight because of a snowstorm. The airline offered us a discount coupon for a hotel and my friend asked for the closest one to the airport. Rooms were fairly clean but shoddy. Breakfast we not even what I would call continental. I would have asked for a better hotel, even at the $60. discount price I didn't like it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: ys126
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the red roof in miami to take a cruise, the service was exellent, they offer free transportation for the port, eddi and kenny were very helpful and kind!!! You guys r doing a very good job

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service, Poor Quality”
Reviews.Author: coconutbreeze
Reviews.Content: Me and a couple other friends booked this room through AAA. We stayed for three nights. The location to the airport was great and the shuttle bus driver was very friendly and knowledgeable. The main lobby was nice, maybe needs a little updating with furniture but other than that nothing bad. However, upon checking in, the lady working at the front told us (very mean-spirited) that the room we asked for was not available and we would have to be in a smoking room in the back building. When we asked (very politely) if we could possibly change rooms the following day to a non smoking, she practically yelled at us that we could not and it was not possible. All the while offering NO apology for the mistake. When we got to our rooms, besides the faint smoke smell, our air conditioning was broken and the toilet would never flush all the way. I had to track down a housekeeper for an extra set of towels (they only gave us 2 to begin with), AND the cherry on top of the cake was that our room was never cleaned once. Despite the mean front desk lady and the bad room cleaning service, everything else was average. However, because of my experience I will never recommend this hotel and I won't be staying at any Red Roof Inns.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: flygirl2011
Reviews.Content: I am flying in and out of Miami to international destinations and frequently need a hotel close to the airport for one night or even just for several hours during the day. The staff at Red Roof Inn is always very accomodating and friendly. The rooms are simple and clean and there is a nice pool. Also, there is a major chain resturant next to the hotel and pizza delivery.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be staying at Red Roofs anytime soon”
Reviews.Author: Lisandro T
Reviews.Content: Even though the staff was very nice and helpful, I had a terrible stay at this hotel. When I checked-in, I got a dirty room. Then, they gave me another room. It smelled humid and bad. The wi-fi was free but it was EXTREMELY slow. Took about three minutes to load your email. During our 2nd night, someone next room turned the tv on, put the volume on max, slammed his/her door and left at 4am. I was not able to sleep well. I could print my boarding pass for free at the business center, but after that I had to pay 40 cents a minute to use the internet and 50 cents per page to print. So expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Would not go back!”
Reviews.Author: R0xy30
Reviews.Content: Room was very dusty and we found a roach even! Breakfast was not palatable....bagels and danish, coffee, oj (which was terrible) and apples on one of the 6 mornings we were there. Repeated attempts to have our room properly cleaned did not make a difference..they did a poor job. The only plus was receiving clean towels everyday but we always had to get extra even though they knew how many were staying in the room, we had to ask at front desk each day for more than the 2 towels they kept putting after 'cleaning'. Location is very convenient but the hotel needs an overhaul like replacing or shampooing the carpets, servicing the a/c etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but in need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: GerryGibeault
Reviews.Content: The price was great but the savings seem to come at the expense of maintenence. Hallway rugs need to be replaced and the whole place would look better with fresh paint. Complimentary breakfast was basic; bagels or packaged pastries, with coffee/tea. There's a complimentary airport shuttle which also does a shuttle trip around 1:00pm to the Port of Miami. There's a pool but it didn't feel like it was heated. The airport shuttle is great if you don't have a car rental since you can connect with a county bus at the airport that goes directly to Miami Beach for only $2.35 each way. The hotel doesn't have a restaurant, but there's a Benigan's next door as well as a restaurant in the Embassy Suites property just a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “For cruisers, this is the one!”
Reviews.Author: icaretravel53
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for the night before a cruise. It has an airport shuttle, and will take you to the port the next day. It also serves a continental breakfast. Booking online was easy (redroofinn.com) and they had discounted prices for teachers, seniors, etc. Look carefully for the one that suits you best. Only small negative is that they tried to charge a couple of dollars extra to use the safe in the room, but as soon as we objected, they removed the charge - I had a copy of my reservation for the room at a set price. This is the hotel you want if you are cruising - last time we had a disastrous hotel - this is by far better and very reasonably priced for the service it gives.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: jimlizblvd2
Reviews.Content: clean & staff was friendly. hard to believe we were in US with all the different languages spoken - felt very off-shore, but interesting.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: petebron
Reviews.Content: stayed while passing through only. average hotel only for the money. old carpet smelled in the hall but ok in the rooms, which were clean. Service not great/nil. Better if you speak spanish, but try to get the girl at the desk to get off the phone was a chore, in fact she booked us in while on the phone the entire time. The irish pub next door was great.

Reviews.Title: “I had a pleasant experience.”
Reviews.Author: Nmalik
Reviews.Content: For a short stay it was quite comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but hard to get to (one way roads), poor service from desk staff”
Reviews.Author: 1995MOM
Reviews.Content: Parking car here to go to cruise worked great. Pool was nice. Shuttle service was rude and unreliable. front desk staff were not attentive to needs like extra towels or clogged sink.

Reviews.Title: “Service at hotel was awful”
Reviews.Author: eenabnit
Reviews.Content: Everytime we would ask the front desk a question they were not very helpful in answering the questions. Many of them did not speak English well at all. The beds were hard as rocks and you were only given two pillows per bed. We checked in with four people per room and there were only two towels in the room. There were no towels by the pool. The stairway smelled like someone had used it for a restroom. We asked for someplace in the area to eat and Eddie told us to go to a seafood restaurant that the shuttle would take us to. He said we would get a discount for giving them his card. What actually happened was he received a commission for sending us there. The breakfast was bagels or danish. They said they had no juice, but did not apologize for being out. Overall not a good experience whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Ordained_Saint
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay if you just need a place to sleep before you go out to have fun. Excellent location, close to the airport... Great continental breakfast. Nothing really to do at the hotel but who wants to stay at a hotel when in Miami anyway...

Reviews.Title: “Great location and shuttle service”
Reviews.Author: JasonC12
Reviews.Content: The proximity to Miami International Airport is ideal. The shuttle service was extremely efficient to the airport and to the Port of Miami. This is a typical Red Roof property in that it is not fancy nor elegant. But, it was clean enough and made our travel plans easy.

Reviews.Title: “very old and smelly--poor service with attitude at front desk”
Reviews.Author: guits
Reviews.Content: A family member and I stayed at this hotel on 10-20-2010 and were quite surprised at the physical condition of the rooms. Basic upkeep of the facility was very poor and my impression was it should of been refurbished or rebuilt 10 years ago. Although some of the workers were very pleasant our experience with the front desk was less than satisfactory. They did not make eye contact or smile and welcome us and this was our first trip to Florida, made a bad impression.

Reviews.Title: “This is my home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Johnfun4
Reviews.Content: I visit Miami almost monthly and always stay at the Red Roof. The facilities are well kept and the staff is very friendly; by now they all know me by name and make me feel at home. Thanks, guys. As I said; this is my home away from home

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: soli_bob
Reviews.Content: Fast and easy in and out-nice room. Convenient to leave car @ only $ 5/day while cruising-safe lot. Short cab ride to Port of Miami-will do this again.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Mary131
Reviews.Content: Having gone on two medical missions to Haiti, I stayed at the Red Roof Inn in MIA in March and September, having flown from New Jersey. Both times the staff was more than accommodating, friendly and understanding to my needs. The room was clean and quiet and fairly close to the airport and the free shutttle was an extra plus. I would highly recommend it to a business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL AND DISGUISTING! DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: jamie04dolphins
Reviews.Content: This was absolutely one of the WORST hotels I have stayed at. First of all the elevators were broke...so we had to carry our own luggage up flights of stairs. The room was old and gross. The bathroom door knob was falling off so you couldnt lock the bathroom door. We used a trash can to keep it closed. The air had one choice on or off...no adjustments could be made so we froze most of the night. The WI Fi did not work and the staff at the hotel was not helpful. I would NEVER recommend this hotel to anyone. Stay away!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excelleny Location and Good Value for money”
Reviews.Author: TanglinPark
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this Hotel at least 20 times and each time I come to Miami. Why? The location is unbeatable and its friendly. Nice swimming pool and free of charge internet. Of course it is not a luxury Hotel. The rooms are very large and clean but you feel they have been done "quickly". You do not hear the planes despite your just next to the airport and "walking distance" from the car rental station. As a conclusion: you get what you paid for....and a bit more!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful extended stay”
Reviews.Author: lovemecaribbean
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on the 29th August 2010 after returning from a cruise. We were suppose to leave the next day but because of the passage of Hurricane Earl we had to extend our stay for an extra three days. Due to this incident we were given a discount which we were so thankful for. The staff was very polite, service was wonderful and the shuttle service left every half hour. The only problem that I had is the continental breakfast; it could have been a little bit more than bagel juice and tea. Overall will highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre-Cruise or Short Stay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tha_Lowkey_One
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because we needed an affordable hotel to stay in prior to departing Miami on a 5 day cruise. We would be arriving the day before the cruise nd only need a place to rest for 1 night. I read about this hotel online and decided to take a chance on it and it far exceeded my expectations. The hotel is located just outside the Miami Airport and they have a free shuttle which departs the terminal every 30 miniutes giving you door to door service between the airport and the hotel at no cost. When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted by very friendly staff and there was no problem with them finding our reservation. At check in we asked about the free shuttle to the port of Miami where our cruise would be leaving from the next day and we were instructed to write our names down to reserve our spot on the shuttle. This also was an easy process. I was suprised to see a convieniece store in the lobby. The prices were marked up but they had anything you could need or that you may have forgot to pack. We then proceeded to our room. The hallways were nothnig to rave about but upon entering the room we were pleasantly suprised. The rooms are very clean and the bathrooms have been updated the bed was very soft and the room smelled clean. We also noticed security gates protecting the parking lot and a secruity guard was always makig rounds. We felt very safe. They have a nice pool although we did not swim. That night we got hungry and found an excellent authentic cuban restaraunt called Latin Cafe 2000 also right by the airport. The food was amazing and gave us a nice taste of Miami. There are also other places to eat in the area which would be a short cab ride away if you were not driving. We actually had rented a car for the night because we wanted to see Miami as I mentioned before the parking lot is protected by security gates so we felt very safe leaving our rental care there. The morning of the cruise we woke up and tried the continental breakfast which consisted of bagels, danishes, fruit, coffee, cappacuino, apple juice, and orange juice. it was your tyipical continental breakfast nothing to rave about. We needed to return our rental car to the airport so we drove it there and dropped it off then took the rental car shuttle to the terminal and then the hotel shuttle back to the hotel. It was a very easy process. Check out is at 1230 and the free shuttle for the cruise leaves at 1 so we waited in the lobby for a short period of time to be called. The shuttle arrived and we got to the port with no problem and had a fantasic cruise. I also forgot to mention they do have FREE WI-FI throughout the hotel. Next time we cruise from Miami we will stat here again it is an excellent precruise hotel or if you need an affordable one night stay. If your are having an extended stay or seeking a vacation hotel I would probablly try one of the other hotels in the area. but if you are cruising or just stopping over in miami and looking for something affordable this is your best bet.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel when you want to live the Miami experience!”
Reviews.Author: JorgeSalo
Reviews.Content: My family and I needed a place to stay in which we would feel free to experience Miami at our will. This hotel is great for resting after a whole day of shopping/sightseeing. The breakfast offered was fair. No restaurant in this hotel, which was perfect for us; after all, Miami has so much to offer that it would be a waste of time to be dining in a hotel. Rooms were clean, spacious and simple. No bells and whistles, just a comfortable room. I would definately stay again here.

Reviews.Title: “Warning No Wi FI”
Reviews.Author: jeffcassel
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through AA.com purely because they advertise free Wi FI Big mistake. I had important emails to send and the rude staff downstairs kept saying it was "temporarily down" and would be restored any moment> I asked if they were sure because if it was going to stay down I would check out and book elsewhere. You guessed it, one hr , two hrs, 3 hrs, there was no wi Fi the entire length of my stay. Instead of apologising they sad I could use the Business Center but would have to pay (though it turned out there was no internet there either) To add to miserable stay the walls are paper thin, the water lukewarm, no bathtub and faulty a/c outlets, worst of all the rude staff who seemed offended I should be requesting the free wi fi they advertise. Give it a miss if you need internet while in Miami or peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Noisiest Hotel EVER!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: EBJ_10
Reviews.Content: Don't stay at this hotel if you expect to sleep. This is the noisiest hotel ever and I am not talking about the planes flying overhead from Miami International next door. The windows are so well insulated you don't hear them. Unfortunately, there isno such insulation against hallway noise. I am talking about constantly slamming doors, people having conversations at the to of their voices and children running up and down hallways at all hours of the day and night. There are plenty of other options close to the airport (La Quinta, Embassy Suites, Marriott Courtyard to name a few), I would recommend trying any of them before trying to Red Roof Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Joyce256
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Red Roof Inn, Miami International Airport, on the night before our cruise with my husband and two sons, ages 20 and 17. We were very pleased with the hotel and staff. We had a free shuttle ride from the airport and to the Miami Port the next day which was very convenient and saved us quite a bit of money. The shuttle driver was so friendly and helpful. Check-in was quick and the people at the desk were also friendly. It was our first cruise and we were unsure about the shuttle the next morning. They helped us get signed up for the shuttle to the port the next day and kept us informed the next morning when the time changed. They also gave us a later check-out time so we could swim later and wait for the shuttle to the port in our room. They pointed the way to Bennigan's and we were grateful to have a restaurant so close since it was after 8:00 PM when we arrived. Each of us ordered something different and we all enjoyed our meals. They have very good sandwiches and cold beers - what more can you ask for! Prices were comparable to other restaurants of this type (mid-price range). There is not alot of other things to do in the area from what we could tell but we were satisfied with dinner next door and swimming in the pool. The room was rather plain but it was clean and had everything we needed. The beds were comfortable, the air conditioner worked well and the price was great. We were only given two bath towels and there were four of us so check on that before you need them. The pool was WONDERFUL - nice size pool, warm water and very clean! The planes go overhead but we didn't hear them at night and it was fun to watch them while we were at the pool in the morning. There was a free continental breakfast which had bagels, danish, fruit and juice. Not the most elaborate breakfast but the coffee was good and my 6'2" boys and husband were satisfied. When we arrived back in Miami after our cruise, we stayed at a hotel in South Beach and all I heard from my sons was "Can't we go back to the Red Roof ." I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: cuquis12
Reviews.Content: Any information about city or transportation you can go to front desk staff, they are very helpful, Ms Nora and Odalys at f/d are always ready to help you. There are coffee available 24/7

Reviews.Title: “They charge you extra nights and the corporate does not answer your complaints”
Reviews.Author: jfroca71
Reviews.Content: I stayed for four days at this hotel that has terrible beds, extremely noisy and bad service. I left in the morning one day and they told me that they could not print my invoice but that it was the rate that it was posted on the internet. My credit card bill came on the mail and they charged me almost double: I havent received an invoice and I have not received an explanation. Unless they charge you !00% percent in taxes this is a no go to people that want to be close to the airport. They advertise free internet but the internet was slower than dial up.

Reviews.Title: “ROACHES ROACHES ROACHES AND MORE ROACHES”
Reviews.Author: cruise19
Reviews.Content: we woke up to find roaches everywhere. on walls in our bed. i even tried to catch some in a pringles can. how can dhec let this place pass.the stafff was nice. she gave discount on our room. never again will i stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: Arson91
Reviews.Content: My wife have stayed 4 times so far at this hotel over the past few years and each time, we have enjoyed our stays. Clean rooms, excellent service. We have no complaints. We have referred the Red Roof Inn (Miami airport) to friends and relatives and they have stayed there also.

Reviews.Title: “don't stay there!”
Reviews.Author: talima
Reviews.Content: From the minute we took the smelly airport bus an 45 minutes to pick us up to the front desk staff it was a bad experence. We had our confirmation number but no room and they were sold out due to a tennis tourament in town. They said ever place in town was sold out. They didn't offer to help in any way. Thank god we walked up the street(with luggage) to another hotel that was also sold out but they were kind to if us a list of hotels in the area. We found one and they even picked us up at another hotel. Don't stay there, the price my be right but they are rude, the bus and lobby smell and they screwed up reservation!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations...”
Reviews.Author: Seabrookgal
Reviews.Content: We came to Miami to deal with the death of a family member and make all the arrangements. We stayed here almost a week and couldn't have been more pleased! The front desk help were extremely courteous and couldn't do enough for us. Our room was large, extremely clean, had a big desk and the WiFi was great. The room was also extremely quiet--especially with the planes overhead. We couldn't hear them or the room next to us. We traveled with a small dog, so we were placed on the first floor near a door for easy access. We even used the small shop when we ran out of toothpaste. Our only negative was that the only restaurant within walking distance was Bennigan's. It's worth a car ride to eat someplace else!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: Muzikbox
Reviews.Content: Your Staff was great, when every I needed something or asked a question they where there . I will be back sometime this year and will make my reservations with the Red Roof Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Dean46Florida
Reviews.Content: Check Bathroom ceiling for mold. Also would put in shower rods with curved rods. More coffee machines

Reviews.Title: “my home”
Reviews.Author: edwardguerin
Reviews.Content: Im very please and happy to know that my business trips are a lot more confortable when I arrive, The Hotel people at the reception are very nice and reservation are on time Im a lucky person to have a relation with the Hotel in particular their staff are always willing to help and do that extra service to make you at "Home"

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: kellbert
Reviews.Content: I had a short two-night stay in Miami and usually stay at the RRI in Fort Lauderdale. My experience at airport locations is usually expensive and not as comfortable. The RRI Miami is an exception. I found the front desk staff to be pleasant and willing to help. My check-in was smooth and all details were correct. I was given a room in the main building facing the pool. Initially was expecting the aircraft noise to be a problem but never heard them once inside. The room was a business king and internet access was included at no charge. (I understand this is now standard with all rooms). The service was sometimes slow. The room was nicely appointed and properly cleaned. The TV was old style but had adequate channels. Towels, soap and shampoo were also satisfactory. The parking is a bit strange- the entrance is on the north side (the other side is barricaded) and controlled by an automatic gate. I guess it gives some security in that you can not leave or enter in a hurry. The only down side I noticed (I reported this) was the endless sheets of pizza shop advertising pushed under the door. This is a nuisance as you have to pick them up every time you enter, or kick them into the hallway. I think management could assist by making these available at the front desk or part of a in-room brochure.

Reviews.Title: “Disgustingly dirty!!!”
Reviews.Author: ama2010
Reviews.Content: This was the most dirtiest hotel I have EVER stayed in. The sheets were yellow, stained, moldy and human hair on both beds. The hair that clogged the drain was unbelievale. The mold on the ceiling of the bathroom was terrible. the bugs in the bathroom were un It appeared that is had not been vacuumed under the beds for several weeks. There was candy, dirt and leaves etc under the bed. The pillows were lumpy and drool stained - we had to put the pillows on the floor and turn down the bed with only the bottom sheet to sleep on. we did not sleep that night - to say the least. The headboards were dusty. I am amazed that this place is still open.

Reviews.Title: “I would not go there again”
Reviews.Author: abehrens
Reviews.Content: The way to the hotel is ok. A shuttle took us there and it was only minutes from the airport. You have rarely nothing to eat around the hotel, that you can reach by walking. The rooms were awful. They were dirty, hairs everywhere, the towels were dirty and I found hair in my bed, which wasnt mine. The breakfast was okay, they had bagels, coffee and some orange juice. But, while we were eating breakfast, they cleaned the lobby - area, which is close to the breakfast area with some digusting eucalyptus stuff. I didnt enjoy my breakfast because it stank in the whole lobby. I wasted time and money in this hotel. I am glad that we only stayed for one night. The staff was okay, they didnt give a lot information and the internet was not free.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: bbrooksCharlestonSC
