Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel to stay at a night before we left on a cruise and to park at. I was a little leery at first given other reviews. But the price couldnt be beat. When we arrived check in was pretty busy but they were very nice and helpful. The room was very clean as was the bathroom. I was worried because the planes were so close but honestly it didnt really sounds all that loud inside. It didnt disturb our sleep at all. When we returned our car was how it should have been. The shuttle to the port was fast, nice and efficient. If we return to the Miami area we will be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Met our expectations, plus great service !”
Reviews.Author: mofongo
Reviews.Content: We've been at this hotel for 2 nights,awaiting our international flight later today.Booked through a park-sleep-fly website,chose this property for its gated parking and 14 nights parking included with room stay.Extra days parking minimal rate. We are realistic in our expectations for an airport hotel; we don't want to pay a bundle,so we don't expect a 5-star property.Room is good size, clean, everything works.Sure,the decor is a bit tired, but again, we know what to expect at this price point. Pool is lovely and every single employee we've encountered has gone out of their way to be helpful. We would absolutely return here for any future Miami flights. Just a special shout-out for reception agent Eddie.He welcomed us on arrival and helped us get a more attractive room rate to include wifi.He also went above and beyond in granting us later check-out time, which helps enormously with pre-flight stress. Personally,we prefer attentive customer service, as in this Red Roof Inn, to a sleek,shiny hotel where the staff can't be bothered to listen to guests' concerns. Good value for our $$---a big thumbs up !

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Marmaris Turkey, Leros Greece, Cortona Italy (each year)
Reviews.Title: “Best deal before cruising”
Reviews.Author: CaptainPwyll
Reviews.Content: I chose Red Roof Inn because it is the ONLY hotel with free transportation to both the airport and cruise port. The price was good compared to other surrounding hotels, it was a great choice for the night before the cruise. Make sure to sign up as soon as possible for departure to the port the day of your cruise. the hotel is comfortable, the staff were helpful, and the location very good. The airport shuttle comes about every half hour and runs after 10 which most don't.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mariaL1984
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for i night and it was a nice hotel! clean beds and nice clean bathroom! also cheap and close to airport and i you want to rent a car next day all car rentals are close by! only negative was the carpet was not really clean...

Reviews.Title: “FLEES, BED BUGS, BED BUG RESIDUE, MILDEW SMELLS”
Reviews.Author: debstarlight
Reviews.Content: Flees, bed bug residue, mildew smells.....This is probably one of worst hotel that I have ever stayed in, and paid so much for! My brother-in-law booked this hotel for $140 per night, as we needed a place to stay prior to our cruise, and most hotels with better reviews were fully booked. I was somewhat concerned, but given that the SuperBowl was approaching, and most hotels were fully booked, we didn't really have much of a choice. One other factor that aided in our decision making was that the hotel provided free breakfast, and transportation to the port, which would be a great saving considering we were traveling as a group. First of all, I'll start with the airport shuttle which arrived shortly after we exited the terminal. The driver informed us that the luggage storage to the exterior of the bus was not operational, and so we had to load all of our luggage onto the bus itself. This was surely a safety hazard as we (all other passengers incl my family) would not be able to the bus in an emergency due to the amount of luggage blocking the exit. The driver did not seem concerned and thankfully the ride took a short time i.e. all of about 10 minutes. When we arrived at the hotel, the check in process was a nightmare. Let me explain... there were two people at the desk and a lot of people arriving. The employees at the desk were dealing with multiple phone calls, and departing guests, who understanably did not want to wait in line - with the sheer number of guests arriving - to seek assistance. After about 30 minutes we were checked into our rooms. I looked around the hotel lobby, and was at this point beginning to develop concern over the potential state of the rooms. I went to grab a cup of complimentary coffee, and was greeted by a table with dirty cups, a very stained table cloth, and three coffee pots that were either cold or empty. Next we scheduled the morning transportation to the port, and were informed by the front desk that we would be called in the morning close to the departure time. We were assigned rooms in the second building toward the rear of the hotel. Unfortunately, during the check-in process my husband had developed an allergic reaction to his sickness patch, and so we asked reception to provide information on the local hospital. We were checked in and assigned rooms in the second building. To get to the second building you need to walk past the lobby, dining and pool area. Once we got into the building the mildew smell immediately hit us, in addition to the state of the floors, walls, and the obvious lack of maintenance. Because of the urgency, we put our bags in the room, and called the local hospital. As I put the paper down by the counter to write the details of the hospital, I was shocked to find it covered in flees. I called my family and immediately told them to remove any luggage from the floors, and to set everything on the suitcase stand provided. During the call my husband noticed that the second bed in our room was not made up completely and was showing the box spring and mattress. I walked over to the mattress to see what the large black/reddish area was on the mattress, and low and behold it was COVERED in bed bug fecal matter, and dead bed bugs. Thankfully, we did not have our luggage on the beds per the guidance of my family, as this pest can be carried from one place to another in luggage and on clothing. My mother-in-law said that the only way she could sleep in her room was with the assistance of Tylenol PM. My husband and I stayed at the hospital for most of the night while my husband was treated, and as I mentioned the hotel to the Dr, he mentioned that he had heard really bad things about the hotel,and even offered us a single bed for the night! Thankfully, my husband was okay, but we were both dreading returning to the hotel. Once we arrived at the hotel, we sat outside by the pool until we just couldn't stay up any longer i.e. around 5 a.m. where I was surprised to find several other guests who couldn't sleep in their rooms for various reasons including bed begs, smells, and broken air conditioners. When we did return to the room we slept in our clothes, on top of the top sheet. Yes, the sheet you should typically remove as it doesn't get washed!! As soon as I woke up the next morning, Iliterally left the room within minutes. I didn't take a shower, brush my teeth or do anything, and quite frankly I wouldn't risk it for fear of picking up something. I had brush-ups and we brushed our teeth outside the hotel. The next morning (thankfully time to check out) we were met in the lobby but a sea of guests all trying to cram into the breakfast area. The breakfast i.e. a bagel, or Danish (single wrapped), and tea or coffee wasn't impressive at all, but we were just grateful to be leaving the hotelâ€¦ so we thought........ The line outside for the port transportation was long, and people were accumulating quickly. When the first bus arrived the hotel personnel were quietly saying the names of guests, and so many didn't even realize they were supposed to be on the shuttle to the port. People without their names on the list we being allowed onto the bus, and as a result the crowd became somewhat disorderly with people shouting and screaming at each other and hotel staff. Of course, the fact that the luggage area was broken did not help. When we did finally get on the shuttle (approximately 1 hour later) I was asked if I would mind sitting on my husband's lap. My sister-in-law was also asked to sit on her husband's lap. I asked the driver how we would exit in an emergency, and he joked about it. Thankfully, I noticed that the back window is an emergency exit. With that we left, NEVER to see the Red Roof Inn againâ€¦ Sorry, I chose not to take photo's of this hotel as it was just too bad, and I didn't need the visual reminder.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS BED BUGS!”
Reviews.Author: traveler27florida
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here before and this is absolutely my LAST TIME.I am a commuter always traveling from coast to coast.This review is to simply state the facts of this red Roof Inn and to address the lack of properly maintained rooms.I am not attacking the entire chain.Also I'm not trying to deter anyone from staying at this hotel either but merely warning you.If you do decide to stay here judge for yourself! I stayed here with my wife in December .The staff is always friendly and the service is very good.The Hotel had undergone a renovation a little over a year ago.We were given a room in the older building in back.Upon entering the elevator it smelled of urine.Upon entering the room we immediately noticed that the floor had not been properly vacumed including merchandise store tags strewn about the floor.Box springs of beds had many stains, brown in color.Vent of A/C unit was filthy and clogged with dust.Bathroom shower tile grout coverd in MOLD! Upon waking up the next morning I felt something on my right leg and could not believe what I saw!I have heard reports on the news a while back about these bugs and knew exactly what they look like.I was absolutely disgusted and grabbed the little creature placed it in a plastic cup and discreetly brought it down to front desk where I met with the head of housekeeping.She could not believe her eyes and apologized to me and stated that she would have the room treated.When I asked how often the rugs were actually cleaned (shampooed) she was not certain.Even though the hotel has been renovated , by the looks of the room it was obviuosly a rushed job.My prevous experiences had not been satisfactory either but I thought I'd give them a break and try one more time.NEVER AGAIN! This hotel shares what is a very common problem of MOST Miami hotels wether they be a 1 to 5 star,CLEANLINESS is definately NOT of paramount concern.

Reviews.Title: “It was great”
Reviews.Author: arpobodyshop
Reviews.Content: I really like the hotel. It's close to the airport and it has breakfast. the people are nice and I always have a good time when I stay there. I love it

Reviews.Title: “Worth your money, trust me!”
Reviews.Author: beckyflag
Reviews.Content: Very nice clean hotel. Comfy beds, great room service, great rates! Very well pleased w/ overall stay! When I return to Miami, this is where I'll stay! Thank you for the great service!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ms1Trinidad
Reviews.Content: I love the staff, very helpful and the breakfast is always ready on time.My free certificate is always in the mail for the rewards program, stay 10 nights get one free..love the offer. Will continue to stay as long as I travel to miami.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a night”
Reviews.Author: james238
Reviews.Content: My adult son and I spent a night here in August 2009 when we were stranded in Miami by American airlines. The airline gave us a voucher to get a room for $66 plus tax,Â  telling us that the normal price of the room was "a hundred and something".Â Â  We later found out that the room with two double beds that we got was normally priced at $69 plus tax.The room was comfortable and large enough.Â Â  There was a free shuttle to and from the airport which was efficient.Â  I didn't have to phone from the airport.Â  We waited about 15 minutes and it passed. We got the wake up call at 6 a.m.. as requested.Â  The free continental buffet breakfast was OK and consisted of orange juice, apples,Â  bagels with cream cheese and jams, pastries and tea/coffee.Â  There was a swimming pool on site which we didn't use.Â  We had dinner at the Bennigans next door.Â  Good selection of burgers and steaks.Â Â  We had two burgers.Â  My son who is vegetarian had the veggie burger, but it appeared to be undercooked although we asked for the burgers to be "well done".Â  Mine was OK.Â Â Â Â Â  Be careful there if paying in cash..Â Â Â  Our young indian waiter gave us change as if we had paid with a $30 when in fact I had given him a $40.Â  I had to draw it to his attentionÂ  before he brought the correct change. We didn't have laptops but the computer in the lobby could be used for the price of 45 cents per minute to access the internet

Reviews.Title: “MY PLEASANT STAYED”
Reviews.Author: ositachispa
Reviews.Content: it is a great location rooms are well kept and that pool is beautifull also at that front desk julieth it that best clerk ask for her and ya will see

Reviews.Title: “The oasis in the desert!”
Reviews.Author: Shammoman
Reviews.Content: There are a myriad of big names and fancy hotels in Miami to choose from. From the cheap to the outrageously priced. From the flea-bag to the opulent. I could afford to stay at any of the abovementioned hotels, having retired from a successful Investment Banking career in my early 40's. I have stayed at various hotels in the Caribbean, Europe and Latin America. This time I purposely chose to stay at the Red Roof Inn Miami Airport. I found it after a flight delay and "BIG" name hotel over booked which left me out in the heat one year on my way back into the U.S. The courtesy and the professionalism of the front desk and staff helped to cool me down. Their accommodations though not the White House made my stay pleasant and comfortable. The punctuality of their shuttle and driver to and from the Cruise ship was a very welcome surprise and calming experience. In short, I'll ALWAYS stay at the Red Roof Inn Miami Airport for it's convenience, cleanliness, accommodations and at the same time where the staff treats you as if you are a VIP guest at a ''BIG" name hotel. Red Roof Inn Miami Airport, you are my 5 star{*****} oasis in the Miami desert of "BIG" name hotels in Miami. Thank you. Best regards, Robert D. Geoghagen, FL.

Reviews.Title: “a friendly hotel in miami”
Reviews.Author: candyman103
Reviews.Content: the red roof inn in miami is a pleasant stay and the syaff is very nice. it really is worth it

Reviews.Title: “Very Close to the Airport”
Reviews.Author: Odojoe
Reviews.Content: We did the Sleep and Fly where we stayed a night and then had free parking at the site for our 9 days out of the country. The room was comfortable and everything worked. The shuttle service runs every half hour and they can manage that with one bus at this location because of the proximity. It is just across the street from the airport. Check in and check out were speedy and courteous. It is a great place to stay when you need to catch a very early flight out int he morning. The hotel also furnished a free continental breakfast ( bagels, danish, juice, coffee).

Reviews.Title: “Worn and threadbare”
Reviews.Author: Shoehorse
Reviews.Content: After a long flight back from Paris we missed our flight out of Miami and needed to overnight with shuttle service. The Red Roof Inn ad said minutes from airport so we called and booked a room and were told the shuttle would be in a certain spot "right away". We waited forever (well over 30 mins) in that very spot in the heat & humidity. The room was very smelly and the air-conditioning did not work. They moved us to another room that was also smelly and the carpet was stained and bare, the double beds sunk in the middle and the sheets were so thin they ripped when I covered myself and the towels were no better. Upon registering the clerk offered a wake-up call and we accepted for 4 am. There was no clock in the room and there was NO wake-up call. My husband had trouble sleeping and thank goodness he awakened on his own and we made it in time for the 5 am shuttle. The exterior looked okay but the inside of the rooms were completely worn out.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and safe budget hotel near Maimi airport”
Reviews.Author: Susanrita
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this hotel post cruise when we could not get a flight out to Syracuse until early the next morning. We usually avoid Red Roof Inns because of the exterior entrances to the rooms in most Red Roof Inns, we find to be both a fire and safety hazard but this one had interior corridors so we chose it as a good budget stay post cruise. They have a shuttle that will pick you up at the airport and take you to the airport free from 5am to 1am. We had a 5 am flight and had to be at the airport at 3:30am so we had them call us a taxi. Front desk staff was very helpful and attentive. **NOTE: they have a daily shuttle run to the port of Miami for cruise passengers at 1pm daily so if your flight arrives at this time the shuttle will be unavailable to pick you up at the airport or take you there. It is clearly marked that the shuttle is unavailable from 1pm-2pm at the hotel, but you wonâ€™t know this if you are waiting at the airport for pickup. The hotel has been recently renovated so everything looked pretty new. The linens were excellent for a budget hotel (We paid $99.00/night). The mattress was comfortable. The dÃ©cor is neat but rather sparse and plain. Room had a tub/toilet room with sink and open clothes area separate. They had a nice pool we did not use. The advertised free Wi-Fi and it was except the connection is through T-Mobile so you still have to sign on for them (They have an hourly/daily/weekly/monthly/yearly) plans so if you are already a customer the internet is free otherwise you would have to pay for the day. They had an iron, ironing board, hair dryer, refrigerator and microwave, TV with free HBO, clock radio/alarm. There are really no eating areas in walking distance. (Mostly park/fly and car rental places). We ordered pizza delivered and there were several to choose from. The elevator worked well and was large enough for luggage. We were satisfied for the price and our needs. Pre-cruise we like somewhere closer to stores so we can pick up items we forgot or didnâ€™t want to drag on the plane and the location is not good for that. Also if you are a light sleeper, hotel is in the take off/landing path and they are quite loud flying overhead.

Reviews.Title: “DISASTER HOTEL, REALLY BAD EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: Luigims
Reviews.Content: I stayed only for one night. i really had a very bad experience from this hotel chain. First at the front desk they overprice the rate, second they give me a really not well cleaned room, with little hairness in the bed , what a disgusting experience ... For my fortune they gave me a double bed room so i could stayed in the other bed, but was a disgusting and bad experience. Too much noise from the cars in the highway , really with bad smell , and the hotel was very poor..

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: WendyMike
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Red Roof for an overnighter before getting on our cruise ship in April 2009. The place was bright and clean upon arrival and we were told that the room we had booked was dirty and for no extra charge they would give us a King room. It was verey clean and bright as well. I was quite surprised at how quiet the room was considering we were right over head from the airport. If you are in the pool in the back ( which by the way is great) it's very noisy. Be prepared to pause allot when having a conversation with someone. The planes overhead are very loud. If you're staying just to sleep for the night before the cruise it's a perfect choice. You have a shuttle that picks you up at the airport and another shuttle that takes you to the cruise ship the next day. There are three shuttles that go. One at 11 one at 12 and one at 1 in the afternoon. They fill the 1 pm one first and then work their way back. Don't by annoyed at the time. We walked off the shuttles gave our bags to the men that were right there and litterally walked right on to the ship. It was fantastic. No waiting in lines or anything. You just can't ask for better than that. My hubby forgot his Bible at the hotel too and it was there waiting for him when we got back from our cruise. We would stay again if in town and we would reccommend this hotel to to others. Oh one last note. If you are expecting a great breakfast the next morning you will be very disappointed. They lack greatly in this area. Bagel and tea or coffee is close to all they offer.

Reviews.Title: “All bad reviews are true!!!!”
Reviews.Author: speak0ut
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here and all the bad reviews are true. The room stunk and was dirty. We had no clock radio, no pen or paper, no coffee maker, above the bathtub a hole had been cut most likely to work on the tub on the floor above and it had been just roughly patched with sheetrock. The ice makers and vending machines were broken, the coffee makers at breakfast did not work and all they had to eat was dry bageles and apples. The fire alarm went off in the middle of the night. The Bennigans next door is no better. It was filthy and their soda machine was broken. The food looked nothing like what I have had at other Bennigans.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Well Located”
Reviews.Author: OSCALGOR
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife went to the red roof inn in february this year, we have stay in this hotel 3 times already and for sure we will go back there. the rooms are clean and medium size, the beds and the pillows are really comfortables. The area is convienience because is close to the airport and is right in the middel of the city They includ the breakfast wich actually we always skip because they have only muffins and coffe. They have parking with security 24 hours and a pool were you can unwind watching the planes taking off. even when is really close to the airport the red roof inn is not noise at all. Value! Oscar and Paty

Reviews.Title: “Very bad smelly room, carpet not vacuumed, coffee cup marks on desk had not been wiped off!”
Reviews.Author: CandyC
Reviews.Content: This is a horrible hotel and I would not stay here ever again. The smell in my room was positively awful, like someone had urinated on the rug or something. The carpet had obviously not been vacuumed as I noticed little pieces of plastic that hold tags on new clothing lying on the floor by my bed, just laying where someone had left them after cutting them off the new clothes. I then sat at the desk and noticed rings on it like a coffee cup would make after it is set down, no one had bothered to wipe them off after the last guest left! So I wiped the desk off myself with a wash cloth. The elevators were positively frightening and ancient, jerking and banging all the way up and down; they did not seem safe at all and I just prayed that nothing would happen while I was riding in them. I was on the 5th floor and so I had to use them. The staff were absolutely rude, I called the hotel from the Mall of the Americas to get directions however the woman who answered could not give me any that I could understand. Her Spanish accent was so thick that when she spoke English I could not understand what she was saying at all. Even with my limited understanding of Spanish I could understand her better when she spoke that. I asked her if there was someone else there who could give me directions and she said "No"; and that was the end of the conversation. I ended up calling the 1-800 number for Red Roof Inns to get directions! And once I had them, it was not hard to find at all; shouldn't have been that hard for the Spanish lady to give them to me. And I have to mention the restaurant next door! I was happy to see a Bennigan's right next door, within walking distance, so I went over and ordered shrimp tempura. Oh what a surprise! I got a plate with 8 small, fried shirmp on it, like you would buy in a frozen food package at the grocery store, not what I have been served as shrimp tempura before at all. And a big lump of mashed potatoes on the plate completed the $14 dinner! I had to ask the waiter to bring me shrimp cocktail sauce, he didn't even know what it was and had to go and ask; I also had to ask him to bring me butter for the mashed potatoes. He seemed like he had never waited a table before in his life and I was his first customer ever! I was already praying that I would get through the night safely with the hotel the way it was, then overheard staff talking to another customer that it really wasn't a Bennigan's restaurant at all, just in name only and it was now under 'new management'. I ate the shrimp and began to eat the mashed potatoes when I noticed a 2 inch long by 1/4 inch wide strip of clear plastic in them!!! That was the last straw and when I showed the restaurant host the piece of plastic that I had found in the mashed potatoes he replied 'Aw that's not gonna hurt you!' He was a trailer-trash looking and acting type of guy. My waiter was more understanding and let me just leave without paying for the dinner saying 'don't worry about it'; so at least I was thankful for that. Remarkably I did sleep well in the stinky room and even though the airplanes from Miami Airport fly right over the top of the place they didn't bother me at all. I can only think that it was my prayers that got me safely through the night at this awful place. I have stayed at Red Roof Inns before and have always found them to be clean with friendly staff, nothing like this.

Reviews.Title: “The dirtiest place on earth!”
Reviews.Author: ashabazz
Reviews.Content: Hey ALL the bad reviews are correct. This place was filthy! We had mildew in ALL the rooms. As if the mildew wasnt bad enough, we had blood on our spread! The bed looked and felt damp and dirty! I wanted to cry! The room was damp and it smelled. All the vending machines were broken! When we first entered the room there were left overs in the toilet! I dont think the room was ever really cleaned. We didnt have any towels or wash clothes in our room and when we asked for some the staff told us they simply didnt have any! We prepaid to stay one night before our cruise and one night after, well we promptly canceled the after! My kids and I tried to sleep in chairs we had nothing else we could do. Our other family members all had complaints about their rooms too! I think the biggest problem was the blood stained bed spread, I complained to corporate office and all they offered was another nights free stay! Like I would ever darken that door step again! We had a brand new expensive swim suit stolen from us and they wouldnt even replace it! There was no customer service, the staff did look over worked and depressed. For the record, when we returned we stayed right next door at the LaQuinta it was like night and day. I really feel the hotel should be closed down. Now if the water still isnt hot and the rooms are still damp, mildewy and dirty and we stayed there over 6 months ago they werent just having a bad weekend, its the way it is FILTHY AND DISGUSTING!

Reviews.Title: “Cheaper hotel but would not return”
Reviews.Author: canuck101-7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night prior to cruising. All of the bad reviews are right on the money....poor service, lack of cleanliness all around, smelly rooms, depressing, dirty lobby with empty/broken juice machines, unpleasant front desk staff who seemed irritated when approached and pathetic shuttle to pier (very unorganized and the bus even broke down on our way there making us some of the last to arrive). This hotel servies it's purpose for one night but I would rather put out a few extra dollars to stay somewhere more decent (and cleaner!).

Reviews.Title: “Dirty room, good APT location”
Reviews.Author: Skopik
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel just to overnight between 2 flights in MIA APT and this is exactly what it is good for. Hotel is just before MIA APT, shuttle OK, you are in some minutes in the room from terminal. The room was not extra clean and smelled bad, very humid. OK for overnight, nothing more/less. Good breakfest. Just in the air corridor, airplanes landing every minute over your head. This hotel should be used for thoose who need one night between flights.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was very good.”
Reviews.Author: headphone
Reviews.Content: Booked my stay through Park, Stay and Fly... free parking for 9 days. It is all about attitude. When I first arrived, i noticed the front desk clerks were very tired and I had a smile, told the one very nice lady I know what a tough day is like and she upgraded me to a deluxe (fabulous) room with free internet, normally internet costs 5.99 per day because it is provided my T-Mobile, and fast... fast enough to play World of Warcraft for 4 hours straight. One of the guys that worked there provided me with a restaurant and I had a great Cuban meal in my room. The pool is nice and the building is very quite, well built because it is older but nicely remodeled.... This is not a luxury hotel but very nice .. I paid 135 for everything including free parking.... my plane leaves for Jamaica in the AM ..will let you know how the free breakfast is and the ride to the airport next time. Take Care

Reviews.Title: “Bad quick stay ever!”
Reviews.Author: PracticalTravelerMn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before going on a cruise. The pool area and lobby area were remodeled and very nice. Pool is very well maintained and in a beautiful setting. Front desk staff was friendly. Shuttle service was good also. That is the good part. Rooms are smelly (mildew) and very unclean. Floors were not vacuumed along the edges, counters were barely wiped, no clock. Don't plan on eating breakfast and getting full, there continental breakfast consisted of bagel and an apple. They did have many different kinds of coffee to choose from but one can not get full off coffee. There is no restaurants within walking distance, so you will have to order in, I would order pool side unless you can stand the smell of your room without losing your appetite. Cleaning staff tryed to get into our room before we had even checked out. I thought this was very rude, they could tell we were not done with our room and it was not even close to check out time. It made me feel very uneasy leaving our stuff in the room after this.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and shuttle service”
Reviews.Author: liesenluc
Reviews.Content: Miami: Red Roof Inn Miami Airport: "Good location and Shuttle service". Date: November 25, 2008 Reviewer: A TripAdvisor Member, Bruges, Belgium. We just stayed 1 night in Red Roof Inn Hotel, Miami airport. This hotel is good if you need a room 5 minutes away from the airport. We slept very well and did not hear an airplane. The free shuttle of the hotel works very good. You don't have to give a phonecall on arrival, because every 30 minutes the shuttle goes to the airport for pickup, excepted some hours in the middle of the night. In the morning we had to go to the office of Avis for pick up of our hired car, and the shuttle brought us to the entrance of the office, so very convenient. The room itself was clean enough, but does not look as nice as on the pictures on internet. In the corners were some big holes in the wall and the bathroom lacks some finishing touch. There is no coffeemaker in the room. Breakfast has little choice, but enough to start the day and there is a nice terrace at the breakfast area, so you can take the breakfast outside if you like. All by all a good hotel if you just need 1 night close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Depressing hotel”
Reviews.Author: conkantor
Reviews.Content: Depressing rooms, worn out with the smell of smoke that 200,000 smokers were in the room at one time. Decent price for an overnight but not worth the dark experience. Next time would find some thing better or sleep at the airport on the rug at a gate.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Nickodimas
Reviews.Content: I stayed @ this Red Roof Inn and I rather liked it. No big whoop and really, who needs a fancy shmancy place to lay his head anyway? It's not exactly a destination point now is it? For me..just a stop between home and the Caribbean. I had a good time swimming and laying in the sun. I walked over to a fast food joint which served interesting Caribbean fare. I also walked to a nearby gas station for snacks and drinks. I found my 2 days there to be pretty relaxing. The desk clerks were friendly and helpful. All in all it was a good stay at the Red Roof Inn. Dig it! As a matter of fact, I will be staying there again this December. So, I say go ahead stay there and remember 'A good attitude goes a long way'. Satisfied guest.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Filthy Flea Bay of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: johntray
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a pre-cruise stay for our group of 52 people. Our travel agent suggested this hotel as reasonably priced. IT WAS AWFUL. We had quite a bit of luggage for our cruise and only one elevator was operable. The rooms were gross. They smelled nasty and were dirty. No hair dryer either so a lot of our party looked a bit different the next day. Bennigan's next door was o.k. Shady characters hanging around. Continental breakfast was pretty much non-existent. Coffee and juice machines were empty or broken. The few muffins that were put out were pre-packaged frozen muffins. Those were gone so early because they probably put out a dozen and that was it. I specifically checked on the availability of the shuttle service to the port since our group was large. They told us it would be no problem and that we should be ready at the pool at 11:00. Only 12 or so people could go on each shuttle trip and there was only one bus. By the way, the bus had a flat tire and the driver drove us all around town to try and fill up the tire. We were the first group to go to the pier. The rest of our group had to wait almost 3 hours to get the pier. The bathroom in the lobby ran out of toilet paper and these poor people had to sit out in the hot Miami sun for a long time with no water or anything. It was a joke. I called the general manager of the hotel when we returned from our cruise. He denied any problems with the hotel. After months of wrangling with the general manager and the corporate office, we were able to get a refund for all of our group members. Very poor service and dirty rooms. Never, never, never would I stay here again nor would I suggest it for even one night.

Reviews.Title: “Disgustingly dirty and badly maintained”
Reviews.Author: aksnowgirl
Reviews.Content: The desk clerk was solo and did his best to help us. The first room was filthy with dirty sheets on one bed. I asked for fresh sheets and the clerk had the security guard watch the desk while he ran them to me. I stripped the sheets and found that the mattress pad beneath was stained all over and the bed was broken and lopsided with an old, dirty, sagging mattress. The carpets were dirty and the walls ewre marked with stains on the upholstry and carpets. I asked for a new room and he obliged. The next room was similar but not as bad. One bed was sagging and unmistakingly broken. The property in general is run down with dirty, unvacuumed flooring, pizza fliers littering the halls and insides of rooms where they have been shoved under doors. The doors slam all night as there are no door stoppers and it is noisy. Based on the price and other comparably priced satisfactory hotels in the area one would expect a much higher standard of service or at least a clean room!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: devonmbeer
Reviews.Content: I'm no professional hotel critic, but after reading all the negative reviews I expected it to be a dump, but it was a pleasant surprise. Free shuttle came every 30 minutes to the airport, just make sure to flag it down because it doesn't have a designated stop anywhere. The room was clean and the pool was really nice. The only discrepancies were with the staff...which there primary language was spanish but they did speak english. It was just hard to communicate some things I was trying to say exactly, but got the overall message across. Also the continental breakfast was doughnuts, muffins, and apples. They also had coffee and hot chocolate. Besides that it was a good overall experience and for only staying one night for a grad interview, it was everything I expected. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews are pretty much accurate”
Reviews.Author: monocle
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't stay here again. The rooms are plebeian, and the free continental breakfast is a joke. We had good luck w/ the shuttle from the airport, but the line for the port was very long; we opted for a taxi. I noticed that some people were able to pay $85 for a night here. That sounds about right for the experience. Unfortunately, we paid $180 for the Saturday night of Presidents' Day weekend; the hotel certainly isn't worth that. Benningan's is right next door and serves good food, although their "signature sandwich," the Monte Cristo, really can't be finished by anyone who's not a glutton. Good for transients, but you wouldn't want to spend more than a night here.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great, but OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: ChrispyMaine
Reviews.Content: Was OK for a cheap place to stay before a cruise. Friendly, complimentary shuttle from airport and to the port. We stayed in one of the newly redecorated rooms out in the back building. Clean and comfortable for our group of 3. Continental breakfast not so great. One of the friendly staff recommended a cuban cafe a block away to get some really good sandwiches. Pool area really noisy with airplanes flying over, but couldn't hear them from the room.

Reviews.Title: “nasty”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoBugsbunny
Reviews.Content: the hotel was nasty, our room smelled and there was mold on ceiling and walls, no garbage cann in room, the airconditioner didnt work, staff didnt answer the phone at the front desk, sinse the room had some kind of smell my allergies started to act up the next morning my friend decided to look in the ice bucket and their was a used sanitary napkin wraped up in toilet paper i woulds not recomend this hotel to anyone it was rated 3 star it should be rated 1 star. i will never stay thier again

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I've ever stayed in, in my life!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: stonegyrl
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at some "bad" hotels but oh my goodness... this one takes the cake - BY FAR!!! We arrived to stay the night in Miami before flying to the Carribean. We chose Red Roof Inn because it was 5 minutes from the airport. The ONLY good thing about it! When we checked in, they gave us a room that was 50 degrees in it! I'm talking, the AC was on full blast turned to dark blue cold! They switched us to another which wasn't really better. We asked for a non-smoking room, but there was a muggy, stale smoking odor in the room anyway. The shower & tub was in bad condition, leaky & rusty. Hot water didn't work very good. We worried about sleeping in the bed, wondering if the sheets & covers were clean because there were women in the hallways trying to get "customers" (meaning prostitution). When we walked past 2 rooms on our floor, the smell of marijuana filled the hallway. The entire night we did not sleep. There was loud noise from the pool area, loud noise up & downstairs, the room's smokey odor made it hard for me to breath while I TRIED to sleep (cause I have astmha) and it was pretty much a nightmare. We even heard the front desk people chattering to eachother, using profanities while we were walking our 3 year old out the door. Totally unprofessional & a total SLUM is the word. PLEASE, do not stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre but close to airport if needed”
Reviews.Author: ConstanceRoshko
Reviews.Content: I needed a hotel to stay at for one night due to a connecting flight early in the morning. I didn't want anything too fancy or expensive however I wanted comfort and conveincence. Since I was booking my hotel last minute due to unexpected changes in travel plans and it was the busiest time of year, I had few choices. I decided on the Red Roof Inn which is close to the Miami International Airport. What caught my eye was free shuttle service to and from the airport starting at 5 am. When I arrived, the staff seemed a bit apathetic, not too friendly nor accomodating. The doors are manual and I had some heavy bags. I struggled to open them while the front desk staff watched me. I checked in and was told my room was outside in another building - part of the hotel. So I had to haul my bags up to my room on the 3rd floor. While heading to the next building, I couldn't help but notice the very pretty swimming pool surrounded by exquisite plants: huge towering palm trees, banana trees, flowers of many sorts....the walk to the next building is surrounded by all sorts of tropical trees and flowers. It smelled amazing! Sadly, I arrived during the coldest day in 3 years (literally) so the time I spent in Miami was bundled up in a jacket trying to keep warm from the wind. I was unable to enjoy the pool or plants as much as I would have liked. There is no restaraunt or room service in the hotel. It is near large freeways so it is extremely difficult to walk anywhere other than to adjacent hotels along the strip. There is one restaraunt located next door, sort of like an Irish-type pub featuring similar grub and drinks. I had a meal there which was pretty good but later I got peckish and there was no where to buy even an apple or some healthy snacks. A bit disappointing. Coffee/cappucino machines are located in the lobby and one is able to help themselves to free hot beverages. However 9 out of 10 times the beverage I selected was unavailable! The juice machine too was not operating. My room was slightly disappointing as well. I requested a non-smoking room but upon entering my room, the first thing I encountered was a stale smell of cigarette smoke. The room was very, very musty It turned me off immediately. I was unable to open the window, which was large and nice. I had a papaya tree growing right below my window and being from Canada, I welcomed such a tropical sight! The room was average: somewhat clean, the bed was very comfortable and I had more than enough space. When I say 'somewhat clean' I must add that parts of the floor had recently been shampooed (ie. *right* next to the bed) and were wet! The bottoms of my socks were soaking when I accidently walked over the shampooed patches. I could only concluded that considering New Year's Eve was the night before and the room was used prior to me.....well, I will leave it up to the reader to make their own conclusions. The washroom was small but clean and pretty. There was an alarm clock provided in my room which was great. I had to be up very early the next day and it was helpful. This hotel offers free shuttle service to and from the airport which I used the next morning. The driver of the shuttle was most helpful with my luggage and ensured I got right to the appropriate entrance needed for my flight (the airport in Miami is gigantic - like its own little community). Would I stay at this hotel again? Perhaps. As long as the room was more fresh and clean. Sincerely, Constance Roshko, Edmonton, AB Canada

Reviews.Title: “Just Say No!!!!!! Horrible..................”
Reviews.Author: jettsetta
Reviews.Content: I booked this property because it was centrally located to both Miami Beach and Kendall. Things went down hill from the moment we walked in. At check-in, the clerk shouted out the room number, although she had written it on the folio, the lobby was full of people. The following day, we opted to assist with the conservation of water and opted not to have our linens and towels changed. To our dismay, after a long day of appointments and shopping we returned to find that our towels were removed and not replaced, upon calling guest services we were told to come to the front desk to collect towels, we also wanted a clothing iron which was to be collected. We walked over to be informed that they only had bath towels and that all of the irons had been lent to rooms for which they had no log. One of the clerks, Milton informed me that he was just coming on to work th 11pm-7am shift and as soon as an iron was available, he would call my room. Never happened! To add insult to injury, returning to the building where our room was located, the entire place was thick with the smell of cigarette smoke, the elevator did not work and the ice and vending machines were inoperable. This hotel boasts that it was recently renovated. What was it like before? In the future, I'll just stay away from anything that is remotely related to Red Roof Inns, and advise everyone to do likewise.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - cheap but awful”
Reviews.Author: Alias605
Reviews.Content: Hotel booking process easy and simple - beautiful property on the outside. Transportation to the port was wonderful - quick and easy to utilize. That's the good - the not so good - The pool was lovely but couldn't be truly enjoyed because of the noise of very close airplanes taking off. Cleanliness of this property was not a priority - hallways reeked of urine, cigarette smoke; bathrooms in the rooms were not clean - moldy and smelled. Elevators were slow- one was not working; Walls between rooms very thin - could hear conversations through the walls. Coffee machine for continental breakfast was broken our entire stay; "breads" were of questionable quality.

Reviews.Title: “Ok....for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: advensyker
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family, after a week cruising in the Caribbean. We arrived before checkin in time, around 10 in the morning. But we were able to check in. The hotel is not a 4 or 5 star, hotel so we didn't expect any luxury And for the price we paid it was fair enough. The room were big enough to fit 4 and 8 luggages. This wasn't our hotel of choice since it was in a land & sea package provided by my mother's travel agent. The hotel staff were friendly and helped us every time we needed them. There's a Bennigan's next door (serves food like TGI Friday) and there's a busstop 100 meters away that goes directly to Miami Beach area. Shopping malls are 10 to 15 min away by car. Taxi can be expensive if youâ€™re on a budget. The pool was great and was open 24 hour. We went swimming middle of night..!! The hotel is near the runway or landing path, but didn't have any trouble sleeping. Nor my mom (and she's a light sleeper) Free shuttle was handy and made sure we arrive on time to check in. All in all a great overnight /airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mango 1-man Island Band Stayed here, Frendly Staff but musty rooms..”
Reviews.Author: IslandFets
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying the staff was very frendly, The rooms were musty, They slide about 10 leaflets under your door every nite. No Wi-Fi....Some elevators not working.... The rates were very low, for an airport hotel.. You know what they say you get what you pay for.. All in all, If you just need a place to sleep, this is a very good value for the money...

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: harmerk
Reviews.Content: Had to call the hotel twice for the free bus to pick us up after waiting one hour it finally came. Went to check in at the front desk and they had the wrong price of about $40. After talking with the 2 ladies they keep telling me that I had the wrong amout, but when I told them what I was told even with taxes what the amount would be. Then an employee came out of the back room who heard the conversation and she told the front desk lady that the price that I keep telling them was on the computer and the front desk got mad at her and told me she was new and did not know what she was doing. I feel like they were trying to take the $40 for the two of them. Finally they gave me the price but I was told the manager could change it back the next day, so I paid by my credit card and had them make a copy of what I have signed. Rooms were not clean. The free bus to the port was so late that we almost missed the ship at 4pm. When we did get on the bus luggage was all over and people was sitting on the luggage and the floor. We all signed in the day before but the hotel made no arragements for all the people who were going and of course I was the last group but the first one on the list since the lady calling the people was the same lady that tried to get me for $40 so just be careful of the front desk workers:)

Reviews.Title: “Pretty basic”
Reviews.Author: hliss
Reviews.Content: Needed to stay in the area at the last minute, and my husband booked the Red Roof Inn at Miami airport. It was a pretty basic room: no hairdryer, and toiletries included one soap sliver and a sample pack of Breck shampoo. Room was large, but a lot of empty space. Beds weren't very comfortable. The shower rod was not installed properly and hung, so the curtain didn't hang right and was mostly open. Toilet tank cover was too small (obviously a replacement) so there was an open gap at the top of the tank. Towels were pretty skimpy (more like hand towels than bath towels). The room did have a TV, safe and phone. The free breakfast included warm juice, donuts, apples, packaged muffins, and coffee from a machine. The breakfast area was not big enough to hold the many folks staying at the hotel. If I needed to stay by the airport and this hotel was super cheap, I would consider staying there again, but it would not be my first choice. For the price (150/night) it was not a great deal for us.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad deal, good service as well.”
Reviews.Author: morseman21
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a perfect hotel for a lay over. I looked it up on Google earth after making reservations only to find out it is extremely close to the end of one of the airports runways. I have to admit I was pretty worried but I stuck with it to give it a chance. I have to say I was extremely surprised, the planes were flying overhead of the hotel yet all you could here was a very faint rumble as if the plane was extremely far off in the distance, I had no trouble sleeping! The rooms seem to have a double panned double tick glass that keeps the noise out; I was extremely happy. The room was very nice and clean with a very pleasant bathroom. My only complaints, location and breakfast. The location is pretty bad, there is a bennigans right next door but nothing else and the breakfast in the morning consisted of juice, apples, a few muffins and a few donuts. I was pretty disappointed with the breakfast. The Shuttle service was very fast and efficient and the drive was very pleasant. I thought this was a great value for what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: SRRLFC
Reviews.Content: It serves a purpose after a long flight but thats about all as there are some well dodgy charcters hanging about. Room was quite large but planes too close for comfort. Free coffee and buffet breakfast was ok, shuttle to Port was good. All in all wouldnt stay there again unless I had to

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: goldair
Reviews.Content: The reception staff were friendly and helpful, but the room left a lot to be desired. The corridor leading to the room was littered with fast food leaflets & you could hear peoples conversations. The room was very damp, in fact the carpet was wet & the paint was flaking off the ceiling as a result. The television screen & pictures showed obvious signs of damp. The pillows had ominous dark stains on them, which could clearly be seen through the pillowcase. In all the room was clean, but very cold. The advertisments claim that this is a redesigned & rededicated property, I dread to think what it was like before. We chose the hotel due to its proximity to the airport & that Red Roof Inns are part of the Accor Group, but found it difficult to find. In fact it took almost 2 hours to find, not something you want after a 9 hour flight. Have subsequently complained to Red Roof Customer Relations, but their response shows disinterest. I'd think very carefully about choosing this hotel. Do your research, there are plenty of other hotels in the area, which offer better value.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the traveler.”
Reviews.Author: surfbecca10
Reviews.Content: After staying in the Ramada Miami Airport North and being totally appaled at the conditions - I called the Red Roof and booked there for my layover on the return trip. The airport shuttle was fast and clean. The lobby was bright and helpful desk folks speed me through registration. The price was right $85, and the room was clean with the new comfort beds, pillows,and shower curtain. It had internet access, HBO, cold A/C, new paint and decorations. Not sure what the other reviewers were unhappy with. We loved it - maybe just redone??

Reviews.Title: “Filfthy!”
Reviews.Author: FreshBreeze
Reviews.Content: Only one night couldn't kill me, I decided, despite the spate of bad reviews. Well, the reviews were right. When I checked in, there was no bellboy. The desk clerk suggested that I leave my luggage in the lobby overnight. Yeah, sure. I might've had an arm in a cast, but part of the purpose in staying at a hotel was to be able to access my luggage, right? For $175/night, I must've been mistaken. When I reached my room, it was filthy and disgusting. The toilet hadn't been flushed, the bed unmade (and this was around midnight), and there was no telephone. When I made it back down to the front desk, I was given another room, which was only slightly cleaner. At least it didn't appear to have been used since it was last purportedly cleaned. The halls were filled with garbage and left-over food. The doors didn't strike me as very secure. The continental breakfast? I've seen hogs slopped under more sanitary conditions. Ooze and goo covered the counters, and the facility looked prime for ptomaine. This place has to rank among the worst of all hotel experiences I've had in 50 years.

Reviews.Title: “Put Chairs up against the door”
Reviews.Author: peg4bluesIdaho
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was horrible. Never again. Figured one night couldn't be that bad, omg. We got to our room which was filthy but figured one night? So there were some advertisements under the door for take-out food and we ordered some . I called the front desk and asked how they would let them in because you needed a key to get in the building and the front desk clerk told me these were people who made the food in their homes and sold it. Make sick he told us. So I figured they couldnt get in the building since it was locked, well one hour later they are pounding on our door and yelling and calling the room. I was scared to death. So we didn't answer and we didn't sleep all night. So if you have to stay there is no security and you need it in that part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: Teleton
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed one (last) night in the Red Roof Inn at Miami Airport onJjune 5 2006. Checkin in went fast and profesionally. The room was clean but very sober. Nothing wrong with the beds. They allow dogs in this hotel and there were plenty of them...... In the room opposite to ours someone left his barking dog unattended for more then two hours. At eight it kept quiet, either the dog has had a heart attack or his master returned. We'll never know but we were relieved anyway cause nobody in the hotel payed any attention to what was happening. The hotel loop on Lejeune is kind of hard to find. Once you know you're way around Miami Airport it is no problem. The question is who knows his way around this area? We've been here several times and it seems you drive from one detour into another. The hotel is located at the end of the runway of Miami Airport and planes fly over very very low but surprisingly they caused not so much noise as the barking dog. So we had a good night rest. Breakfast is a donut, but who cares? There is a Bennigan's at the site and it was surprisingly good. Rental car return is right around the corner. What more do you need? Nothing wrong with this airport hotel!

Reviews.Title: “glad was just for one night”
Reviews.Author: westcotesgirl
Reviews.Content: Arrived after long flight from uk - was just booked for one night before we left for the Keys. Hotel staff very freindly and welcoming - pool looked ok. breakfast was ok. Room smelt of damp, and also the bathroom floor left a lot to be desired - some sort of wooden veneer on floor which smelt of urine! not ideal flooring for a bathroom. However the room and bath / sink were clean. Not sure that I would book again

Reviews.Title: “OK for one night”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Red Roof Inn for one night, because we had an early flight and wanted to avoid the hassle in the morning. First problem was that arriving by car we found it difficult to find the entrance to the hotel and ended up making circles around the place, until we decided to return the rented car first and then catch the shuttle to the hotel. Finally arriving to the hotel they did not have our reservation. I had made it and paid it through travel agency two weeks prior the arrival. The two receptionists talked spanish with each other so it was difficult to follow, but it seemed to me that they just made a new reservation, luckily fot us they had rooms available! The room itself was OK for the price, but nothing to tell to your grandchildren about... We took the shuttle to the airport at 6 oÂ´clock in the morning and that worked properly. Probably wouldn`t stay there again, but it was tolerable.
